programme.desc: Gethin Jones hosts the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Crimewatch Live
programme.desc: Rav Wilding and Michelle Ackerley showcase the work of frontline forces and ask for viewers' help on unsolved cases

programme.title: Critical Incident
programme.desc: In Lancashire a police sergeant receives life-changing injuries when he is the victim of a brutal attack, but he's determined to return to work. In Northamptonshire a police dog comes to the rescue when his handler faces a dangerous car thief, and in Bristol a man goes on a knife rampage in a busy high street

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts meets an archaeologist who is really digging the bungalow he's unearthed in Dover, Kent. Later, in Warwickshire, he finds that a cutesy canal-side cottage isn't quite as charming as it first appears. Meanwhile, Dion Dublin visits his old stomping ground in Burnley in Lancashire, but struggles to find anything worth keeping in a dire and dingy two-bed terrace

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion leads today's Red and Blue teams in Peterborough. Experts Roo Irvine and Stephanie Connell assist the couples battling at the East of England Showground

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Kirsty opens up to Karen and Luca and Jamie's date night doesn't go as planned. Al is worried about an elderly patient in an unlikely relationship

programme.title: Jay Blades' Home Fix
programme.desc: Jay and his guests Jake Robinson and Sarah Moore demonstrate how to grow lettuce, make a stained-glass window and build a dresser

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson meets a couple with a generous budget of £700,000, who want not just to buy a sanctuary in the Lancashire countryside for themselves but also invest in enough land to home some much-wanted donkeys. Away from a very positive house hunt, Jules visits the Helmshore Mills textile museum and meets the committed local people who are preserving this important part of Lancashire's industrial heritage

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Izzie Balmer and Ishy Khan go treasure hunting around Derbyshire. Izzie has her sights set on a little something for the breakfast table, while Ishy has some miniature sporting equipment in mind. Away from the shops, Izzie heads to Derby to see a huge collection of Victorian toys that were the home entertainment systems of the day, as well as being a novel form of advertising aimed at theatregoers. Ishy heads to Matlock Bath, just in time to take part in a festival of lights that took its inspiration from Queen Victoria

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Intrepid team members Nick, Martin, Andrew and Simon compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp present a lively mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Stacey has an accident at her new job after exhausting herself working the night shift as a cleaner and in the food van during the day. Callum makes a decision and Nish is rattled when he doesn't hear from Suki

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: A plastic-free soap brand hopes to clean up with potential investors Peter Jones, Deborah Meaden, Touker Suleyman, Sara Davies and Steven Bartlett. Plus, the entrepreneurs behind mouldable fixing sticks claim they have found an alternative to glue, a 15-year-old enters the Den to help pitch a football board game and a micro-campervan business drives a hard bargain. Presented by Evan Davis

programme.title: The Apprentice
programme.desc: The candidates are tasked with creating and branding a new dog food before pitching to major retailers. In the kitchen one team argues over the recipe for their signature dish, while on the other side a premium product fails to deliver. Later, in the boardroom, Lord Sugar assesses their collective efforts and removes another hopeful from the process

programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests in London to answer questions from an invited audience on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week

programme.title: Newscast
programme.desc: BBC journalists including Adam Fleming and Chris Mason host a weekly round-up from Westminster, delivering the usual mix of serious analysis and light-hearted gossip about the biggest stories in politics

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Jo Brand picks up the mantle as guest host, with comedian Susie McCabe and journalist Camilla Long joining team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop as they delve into the news headlines of April 2022

programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.desc: Rav Wilding and Michelle Ackerley showcase the work of frontline forces and ask for viewers' help on unsolved cases

programme.title: Critical Incident
programme.desc: In Kent, an officer and his police dog chase down a criminal. A brave PC confronts an armed robber when he enters a restaurant with a knife and a fire-fighter in Leicestershire is assaulted when he tries to put out a garden fire

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martel Maxwell, Martin Roberts and Dion Dublin follow the progress of a multi-apartment property in south Wales, a mid-terrace on Merseyside and a ground floor flat in Birmingham

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents from Brighton Racecourse Antiques Fair, with the help of experts Danny Sebastian and John Cameron, and relives the 1960s with a group of original mods

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: Sullivan's dream of leaving Kembleford is scuppered when he is arrested for receiving stolen goods. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team bring more treasured family heirlooms, and the memories they hold, back to life. Ceramic conservator Kirsten Ramsay carefully restores a cherished but chipped piece of 1960s pottery, but with pieces missing and a highly polished finish to mimic she has her work cut out. A military campaign chest that's been through the wars and two much-loved Dutch chairs in need of caning are also restored

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman embarks on a house-hunting mission in the Shropshire countryside, balancing the dreams of a father who has a £475,000 budget and wants to head for the hills, while his daughter wants him to live closer to a community. Nicki also heads to Wenlock and tries her inexperienced hand at pot-throwing and the Japanese art of raku, a pot-firing technique that produces some dramatic results

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Ishy Balmer visits the first Jain temple in the western world and Izzie Khan discovers the history of folk art. Later, the final auction in Leicestershire, sees broken pineapples, legless glass ladies, mystery board games and an antique pub table - but which items will make the duo some money?

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Intrepid team members Christine, Elaine, Karen and Katie compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Rugby union player Danny Cipriani, W Series World Champion Jamie Chadwick, former Sunderland striker Kevin Phillips and Commonwealth gold medal-winning weightlifter Zoe Smith join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Beyond Paradise
programme.desc: The peaceful community of Shipton Abbott is rocked when beloved painting the Solo Mare disappears in a seemingly impossible heist while plans are in motion for its appearance at an exhibition. The theft is even more perplexing given the artwork was under the guard of PC Kelby Hartford at the time. Kelby feels responsible and Humphrey pulls out all the stops to recover the priceless piece. Drama, starring Kris Marshall and Sally Bretton

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: DI Mooney and the team become embroiled in the mysterious world of faith healing when a blind woman dies while being treated by renowned healer Steadman King. When it turns out the victim was poisoned, all eyes turn to Steadman and his cup of holy water. But how could the prime suspect have carried out the deed in front of an audience without anyone noticing? Meanwhile, JP is put through his paces when Pico the police dog joins the team on a week-long trial, and Florence tries to recreate some of Jack's home comforts

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: The second of two compilations of highlights from the recent series. Among the guests featured are Tom Hanks, Cate Blanchett, Austin Butler, Michelle Yeoh, Hugh Jackman, Naomi Ackie, Brendan Fraser, Judi Dench, Jamie Dornan, Kate Winslet, Lizzo and Margot Robbie

programme.title: The Wedding Planner (2001)
programme.desc: San Francisco wedding planner Mary Fiore organises other people's nuptials but has never had much luck in love. One day she is swept off her feet by handsome doctor Steve Edison. They spend a magical night together and all seems perfect, but her dreams of him becoming her husband suffer a setback when she discovers she has already been hired to organise his marriage to another woman. Will true love find a way? Director Adam Shankman's romantic comedy, starring Jennifer Lopez, Matthew McConaughey, Bridgette Wilson-Sampras, Justin Chambers and Joanna Gleason

programme.title: Sunday Morning Stories
programme.desc: The Rev Kate Bottley discusses the importance of wellbeing, meeting therapy dogs that help children learn to read and visiting the UK's first Muslim Ballet School

programme.title: Coastal Defenders
programme.desc: Team members inspect an oil tanker the size of two football pitches, which must be examined inch by inch before it is allowed to set sail. With the potential to carry enough crude oil to power a third of the country for a day it is vital they do not miss anything that could mean a disaster in the event of a spillage. Meanwhile, a second team is called out to repair a vital piece of equipment on a cargo ferry that is holding up the transport of vital supplies to a nearby island

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Izzie Balmer sets off on a road trip with a new rival, jewellery expert Ishy Khan. They kick off in Kendal, with £200 each, looking for antiques that will make them the most profit

programme.title: Winterwatch
programme.desc: Michaela Strachan celebrates one of Norfolk's most sensational winter species, pink-footed geese Chris Packham will be catching up on all the action from the live wildlife cameras. In Edinburgh, Gillian Burke and Iolo Williams move to the coast, to showcase Scotland's marine species

programme.desc: The latest headlines, breaking news and sport from the BBC newsroom.

programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the game show in which 24 recurring contestants compete for the chance to win a £10,000 jackpot, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore the history of the Vegetarian Society and discover how the movement changed public attitudes and became part of the mainstream. They also consider how British gardening has influenced the nation's cuisine, and provide a few recipes along the way

programme.title: Yellowstone
programme.desc: The arrival of summer in Yellowstone brings a new challenge for the beavers as their river dries up, forcing the colony to move. As food becomes scarce, the wolves have a surprising strategy to keep their pups fed, while grizzly bears pay an unexpected visit to a cowboy ranch. By midsummer, the hot and dry conditions create a new danger as deadly wildfires threaten to engulf a family of great grey owls. Presented by Kate Humble and Patrick Aryee

programme.title: Priceless Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents memorable moments from the long-running series, focusing on controversial items. Plus, there is a peek behind the scenes of the Roadshow

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: The team visit Herstmonceux Castle, where antiques experts Jonathan Pratt and James Lewis find treasures to take to auction, including some beautiful bronze sculptures. Paul Martin takes a trip on a very large miniature railway

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Mina Anwar, Glen Moore, Kiri Pritchard-McLean and Shaun Williamson go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Coastal Defenders
programme.desc: The dive team face one of their smallest but trickiest challenges in the shape of mussels. These small shellfish have blocked the pipes of a huge vessel, stalling it in dock. Now it's up to the divers to blast the mussels out of their hiding places to allow the ship to sail once more

programme.title: Back in Time for Birmingham
programme.desc: The Sharma's journey enters the 1970s. Opening a shop, they join an explosion of South Asian entrepreneurship in Birmingham, but they soon discover that a shopkeeper's life involves long hours and plenty of manual labour to keep the shop stocked, priced and competitive. Later, Noreen Khan joins the family for a rare evening enjoying an innovative new sound that is sweeping through the Midlands - Bhangra - and the family dance the night away with a band fronted by Bhangra legend Balbir Singh

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs from London and the South East serve up their mains and desserts. Dishes include an oven-roasted squab pigeon with pancetta, pumpkin and marsala sauce inspired by Fantastic Mr Fox, and a Peruvian-inspired main celebrating Paddington featuring a spiced sirloin of beef, a short-rib beef and marmalade sandwich. Puddings include an ice gola with passion fruit and pomegranate celebrating The Snowman by Raymond Briggs, and a frozen fennel meringue, gooseberry curd and poppy seed tuile served in a flower pot inspired by Fifi and the Flowertots

programme.title: Saving Lives in Leeds
programme.desc: In the Leeds Children's Hospital, paediatric consultant Naved Alizai prepares to perform the high-risk and complex operation needed by eight-year-old Ollie, who has a blockage in the blood supply to his liver. If left untreated it could prove fatal. Also on Naved's surgery list is one-year-old Maya Mae, who was born with a large cyst growing in one of the ducts to her liver. At St James's Hospital, endocrine consultants Sheila Fraser and Emma Collins prepare to remove a tumour from the thyroid gland in an 85-year-old patient's neck

programme.title: Our Flag Means Death
programme.desc: Upon discovering that his family has moved on in his absence, Stede vows to make things right with his wife, Mary. After a desperate attempt to stage a show for the crew, Izzy confronts a depressed Blackbeard about his former life

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: The Boy in the Striped Pyjamas (2008)
programme.desc: Bruno, a boy in Nazi Germany, moves to the country when his father is placed in charge of a concentration camp. While exploring the woods close to the facility's boundary, he spots a Jewish youngster being held there, and the two become friends - but Bruno remains innocently oblivious to the camp's true purpose. Drama, starring David Thewlis, Asa Butterfield and Jack Scanlon

programme.title: Dave
programme.desc: Mike decides he should become Dave's manager, and Dave is convinced he has picked up an infectious illness from rapper Young Thug at a party. Elz gets to work with Trippie Redd

programme.title: Saved and Remade
programme.desc: The workshop is full of history and memories, as a stunning Polish cloak that once belonged to a musician and a collection of family rings are among the items the remakers transform. Presented by Sabrina Grant

programme.title: Putin vs the West
programme.desc: Putin intensifies his aggression toward the West, from the Salisbury poisonings to clashes with Donald Trump over nuclear missiles, and fiery rhetoric aimed at NATO, concluding with the moment he launches his invasion of Ukraine. The Head of the CIA, Bill Burns, recounts his secret mission to Moscow to deliver a stark warning to Putin that US Intelligence was on to his plan to invade, while NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg tells of the last-ditch diplomatic efforts to avert war

programme.title: Scarlett's Driving School
programme.desc: Fifty-six-year-old Linda is desperate to get a driving licence so she can help look after her grandchildren, but as an 'older learner' who is hard of hearing she has failed her test six times. Teaching Linda is her 53-year-old sister Debbie, but after three years in the car together, both of them are at the end of their tethers. Can five days at Scarlett's Driving School help create some calm in the car, and more importantly give Linda the parking and navigation skills she needs to pass at her seventh attempt?

programme.desc: The Rev Kate Bottley hears from people who have used their religion and self-belief to overcome adversity in their lives, including a couple determined to not let their different faiths be a barrier to them getting married

programme.title: Coastal Defenders
programme.desc: A luxury floating hotel in London's Docklands has a rusty hull and the members of the dive team are charged with making it shipshape once more. They then faced with danger on the water as they attempt to rescue a stricken cruise liner amid one of winter's worst storms

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Izzie Balmer and Ishy Khan embark on the second leg of their trip, crossing the Pennines to rummage through the shops of Lancashire and Yorkshire. Ishy finds an iridescent alligator for just a few pounds, while Izzie goes for jewellery and finds an abnormally long Victorian ruler

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: Alice Roberts visits more archaeological digs around the country, finding out about discoveries that shed new light on British history during the prehistoric, Roman, Saxon and Tudor eras. In this edition, she examines a Dutch ship sunk by the English, a Cornish Roman fort and a 5,000-year-old Neolithic monument

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore the food provided by British waterways as they fly-fish for trout, prepare a meal of stuffed wild duck and discover how the Gloucestershire tradition of eating baby eels has virtually disappeared

programme.title: Gorilla Family and Me
programme.desc: Part one of two. Wildlife cameraman Gordon Buchanan travels to the Democratic Republic of the Congo, where he realises a lifelong dream by spending time with Grauer's gorillas, the largest primates on earth. He meets the fearsome alpha male Chimanuka and two babies, one a lonely orphan and as Gordon gains the trust of these mysterious, seldom seen animals, he discovers their incredible compassion and gets caught up in a battle between giant rival silverbacks for control of the family

programme.title: Priceless Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents another selection of clips from the series, this time highlighting some of the most dedicated collectors to have appeared on the show. Plus, the latest additions to the Roadshow's team of specialists discuss how they have adjusted to their new roles

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents as people are invited to try to make money out of their antiques by taking them to auction

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Mina Anwar, Glen Moore, Kiri Pritchard-McLean and Shaun Williamson test their general knowledge skills on their penultimate day of head-scratchers

programme.title: Coastal Defenders
programme.desc: The diving team get a late call from a boat in peril. A missing lifeboat cannister means a ferry is unable to sail, causing chaos for the passengers that use the service for their daily commute. It's a needle-in-a-haystack hunt in near-zero visibility - and to make matters worse, local leisure cruisers create imminent danger for the diver underwater

programme.title: Back in Time for Birmingham
programme.desc: The Sharmas' journey through British Asian history continues into the 1980s and 1990s, a time when the hard work and sacrifices of South Asian families were beginning to pay off. The family convenience moves away from serving a predominantly South Asian clientele to a mini-mart serving a wider range of customers, and 1982 sees the shop stocking their first VHS tapes for hire. Later, the Sharmas host their last end of era party and reflect on what this journey has taught them about the South Asian experience

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two highest scoring chefs from London and the South East go head to head and cook their six-course menus again. They serve their dishes to the panel of judges - Tom Kerridge, Nisha Katona, Ed Gamble and today's guest, celebrated illustrator Dapo Adeola. Andi Oliver hosts

programme.title: Murder in the Pacific
programme.desc: The documentary continues with the investigation into the sinking of the Rainbow Warrior in May 1985. Just one day after the explosions that sunk the Greenpeace ship, police were overwhelmed with calls from people claiming to have spotted unusual goings on. One witness led to Swiss tourists Alain and Sophie Turenge. They came into the station voluntarily but their inability to answer simple questions led police to doubt their identities

programme.title: Mandy
programme.desc: A look at curses, with Mandy explaining why a person will be dead within a week if they stare into the eyes of a forest goblin Comedy short, written, directed by and starring Diane Morgan

programme.title: The Apprentice: You're Fired
programme.desc: The candidate who ended up in the doghouse after this week's task joins Tom Allen to talk about their time on the show, while a panel of celebrity fans and business experts give their thoughts on the unfortunate entrepreneur's progress

programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Victoria Derbyshire

programme.desc: After winning a Grand Slam, the star players of Wales are eyeing up the ultimate test - a British and Irish Lions tour against the All Blacks - but what will happen in New Zealand will change the life of the prodigiously talented outside half, Barry John

programme.title: Saving Lives in Leeds
programme.desc: In the Leeds Children's Hospital, paediatric consultant Naved Alizai prepares to perform the high-risk and complex operation needed by eight-year-old Ollie, who has a blockage in the blood supply to his liver. If left untreated it could prove fatal. Also on Naved's surgery list is one-year-old Maya Mae, who was born with a large cyst growing in one of the ducts to her liver. At St James's Hospital, endocrine consultants Sheila Fraser and Emma Collins prepare to remove a tumour from the thyroid gland in an 85-year-old patient's neck

programme.title: The Warship: Tour of Duty
programme.desc: After travellingmore than 20,000 miles, HMS Queen Elizabeth heads from Japan back to of the tropical island Guam for vital maintenance. Soon, however the ship and its escorts are back at sea and sailing towards the disputed waters of the China Sea, where they join up with other allied warships for a display of military might in front of the Chinese navy

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Holidays
programme.desc: Angela Rippon, Gloria Hunniford and Julia Somerville report on the hotel infinity pool that collapsed and Simon Calder has advice on how to save money sightseeing

programme.desc: Rev Kate Bottley hears from people who have given up their time to help others, including the UK's youngest chief executive and a couple who offered their home to a Syrian refugee

programme.title: Coastal Defenders
programme.desc: A mooring structure on the Isle of Wight ferries is in desperate need of repair, bringing the entire terminal to a standstill. The dive team arrive to repair the seaworn structure, working day and night to get the job done on time, but the task is made worse when they come across a mountain of discarded rubbish ranging from teacups to prams

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Auctioneer Izzie Balmer and jewellery expert Ishy Khan explore the county of Yorkshire, pointing their vintage golden Volvo towards the likes of Knaresborough, York and Harrogate, before heading south for their third auction. They also discover an awful lot of fascinating history along the way, including a trip to a spa and the little-known story of a woman who played a part in setting up some 200 schools around the world

programme.title: Serengeti
programme.desc: As the drought ends and the land returns to its former beauty, newborn giraffe Twiga takes his tentative first steps, trying to control his gangly legs - and he must learn quickly as lioness Kali is on the prowl. Another baby enters the elephant herd, and shortly after the newborn's father appears to greet his son in an awe-inspiring moment. Mafuta and the rest of the hippos return to the river, only to find the crocodiles have laid claim to the riverbank - so the hippos try to evict their old enemies

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore the popularity of takeaway food in Britain and discuss the various ways that it has evolved over the years. The culinary duo also rustle up some of their favourite dishes

programme.title: Gorilla Family and Me
programme.desc: Part two of two. Gordon Buchanan returns to the Democratic Republic of Congo in the hope of finding the gorilla family again, and discovering the outcome of silverback Chimanuka's confrontation with a rival. He soon finds the apes, but discovers their lives are now under threat from poachers, and works with the local rangers to prevent them coming to harm

programme.title: Priceless Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents more memorable moments from the long-running programme. Veteran experts discuss how they developed their sales patter, while jewellery specialist John Benjamin recalls a memorable visitor to the show in Belfast

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents from Croome stately home in Worcestershire, where Natasha Raskin Sharp eyes ceremonial gold epaulettes and David Fletcher comes across an unusual vase

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Mina Anwar, Glenn Moore, Kiri Pritchard-McLean and Shaun Williamson keep their eyes on the prize as Richard Osman reveals who is the week's winner

programme.title: Coastal Defenders
programme.desc: The dive team are charged with clearing abandoned boats causing an eyesore and navigational hazard in a picturesque part of the river. Facing the threat of dangerous chemicals, metal boats and lots of mud the team must chase the tide in what is one of the most unusual daily commutes. But when disaster strikes, the divers are left stranded into the night on one of their most challenging jobs yet

programme.title: Back in Time for Birmingham
programme.desc: Noreen and Yasmin Khan join the Sharma family with their friends for a party to mark two events - Divali and the very English tradition of Bonfire Night. They reflect on what they've learned by exploring their family and cultural history and toast their Back in Time experience

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Another look back at some highlights from the show, as Monty Don demonstrates how almost anything that holds soil and drains water can be used to grow seasonal veg, salad crops and herbs. Frances Tophill visits some hardy gardeners on the Isle of Man whose beachfront plots are at the constant mercy of the sea, and Arit Anderson meets a woman on a mission to 'green up' neglected urban spaces

programme.title: Becoming Frida Kahlo
programme.desc: Documentary charting the life and career of the Mexican artist, beginning with her early years when a young Frida grew up in a time of revolution. The programme looks at her rebellious schooldays and a fateful encounter with Diego Rivera, then one of the world's most famous artists and the man who would change her life

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Sindhu Vee hosts this episode of the comedy showcase recorded before a packed house at London's Hammersmith Apollo, featuring stand-up performances by New York-based Edinburgh comedy award winner Alex Edelman, and at the Edinburgh Festival Fringe Comedians' Choice Award winner Lou Sanders

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, with Christian Fraser

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Couples Therapy
programme.desc: Orna and Dale investigate his aversion to India's expressions of anger, and a minor squabble between Molly and Josh leads to an explosive revelation

programme.title: Couples Therapy
programme.desc: Orna confronts Will about his lack of engagement with Ping, while Molly and Josh deal with the fallout from their previous session. A startling comment from Cyn threatens her renewed connection to Yaya

programme.title: Dave
programme.desc: The rapper prepares to open a show for big-name star Meek Mill. He asks GaTa to be his hype man on stage. However, as GaTa's behaviour becomes more and more erratic, it may be impossible to keep his biggest secret from his new friends

programme.title: Dave
programme.desc: The rapper and his crew travel to his home town of Philadelphia, where he is about to give his first big live show as opening act for Meek Mill

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Marianna Spring reports on how Elon Musk's ownership of Twitter is transforming one the world's most influential social media platforms. Current and former insiders in San Francisco and the UK reveal how hate and misogyny are thriving under the new owner, following the dismissal of thousands of staff and the reinstatement of users previously banned for breaking Twitter's rules

programme.title: Marie Antoinette
programme.desc: Louis supports the rebel colonies in America against France's old enemy, England, despite misgivings at court. Though still with no son, Antoinette moves to the Petite Trianon, where life is less formal. Then a face from the past, Swedish noble Count Fersen, arrives, complicating matters

programme.title: Our Flag Means Death
programme.desc: After Blackbeard's old pal Calico Jack pays a visit to the Revenge, Stede begins to feel like a third wheel. In his despair over Jim's absence, Oluwande gives his room to Frenchie and Wee Jack, who relish the opportunity to design their new space. Meanwhile, Jim returns to Jackie's for more information on the men they seek

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Following the route of the old Caledonian Railway Company, Michael Portillo discovers the 'Riviera of the Highlands'. With a daily direct train service to Kings Cross, Gleneagles remains a top destination and is also headquarters for the British School of Falconry. Berry Town, aka Blairgowrie, is Michael's next stop. At the home of the Scottish raspberry industry, which once sent fruit to London daily on board a raspberry special service from Cooper Angus station, Michael learns how to pick this most delicate of berries. The last stop on this leg is the city of Dundee, where he visits publisher DC Thomson

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: In the early 19th century Staithes was as one of the largest east coast fishing ports, and even now the harbour building renovations reveal the seaside village's impressive financial boom. Archaeologist Ben Robinson explores the harsh North Yorkshire coastline that surrounds Staithes, as he finds out how the village was built to be a safe haven. It was also a settlement rich in the natural resource of shale. Contributors include local author Peter Appleton and fellow archaeologist Caroline Barrie Smith

programme.title: Chris Packham's Animal Einsteins
programme.desc: The presenter introduces the unique talents of the world's most intelligent animals, investigating how nature's masterminds measure up against human brain power. Looking at a variety of animals, such as ravens, crows, bees and starlings, Chris explores how different animals can use tools, solve complex puzzles, recognise themselves in mirrors and even reason like humans

programme.title: Six Wives with Lucy Worsley
programme.desc: Documentary charting key moments in the lives of Henry VIII's wives, combining dramatised scenes with the presenter's own contemporary historical comment. In this episode, Lucy follows Catherine of Aragon through her emotional and physical struggles to give Henry the heir he so desperately needs to continue his dynasty. When Catherine finally gives birth to a baby girl, Henry's eye wanders to the ladies at court - first Mary Boleyn, and then to her sister, Anne

programme.title: The Six Wives of Henry VIII
programme.desc: Classic drama focusing on the Tudor monarch's relationships with each of his wives. Catherine is widowed at only 16, and after the death of the miserly Henry VII, she marries the young handsome Henry VIII. Could any two people be so much in love? Starring Roger Michell and Annette Crosbie. From 1970

programme.title: The Six Wives of Henry VIII
programme.desc: Classic drama focusing on the Tudor monarch and his wives. Catherine is dead and Anne Boleyn is now queen, but two years on her promise to give Henry a son remains unfulfilled - and the outcome will lead more than one person to the scaffold. Starring Roger Michell and Dorothy Tutin. From 1970

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Following the route of the old Caledonian Railway Company, Michael Portillo discovers the 'Riviera of the Highlands'. programme.title: Louis Theroux Interviews
programme.desc: Louis meets the Oscar-winning actress at her home in Surrey for a candid and lively conversation about her long career, her passion for theatre, her life away from acting and her relationship with her husband, the late Michael Williams. Louis also accompanies Judi to the Gielgud Theatre in London's West End, where they discuss the difficulties of the lockdown and how it inadvertently led to her surprise popularity on TikTok

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his railway journey from Newcastle to Loch Ness, steered by his 1930s Bradshaw's Guide. Stopping at Dundee, Michael heads for Glamis Castle, where Lady Elizabeth Bowes-Lyon, the Queen Mother, grew up. Michael hears about her happy childhood and how she later found sanctuary there, when King Edward VIII abdicated and she and Prince Albert unexpectedly became king and queen of the United Kingdom

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson pays a visit to the beautifully preserved village of Arnside, sitting just outside the Lake District on the banks of the River Kent. Once serving the port of Milnthorpe, the village expanded with the arrival of ship carpenter John Crossfield, leading to its expansion in the early 1800s as part of the boat-building industry. Ben talks to Victorian industry expert Dr Stephen Caunce and meets a descendant of the Crossfields family, talking about the village's tourist success and architectural history

programme.title: The Blob: A Genius without a Brain
programme.desc: Documentary about leading scientists' investigations into the properties of a one-billion-year-old, single-cell organism that could challenge the concept of intelligent life

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Treasures Shorts
programme.desc: Dan Cruickshank's journey takes him through Japan, where he marvels at the craftsmanship of a samurai sword

programme.title: The Eagle Has Landed (1976)
programme.desc: A Nazi secret agent plans to kidnap Winston Churchill while the prime minister spends a weekend in the Norfolk countryside, and plants covert operatives in the area ready for his arrival. Second World War adventure, adapted from Jack Higgins' novel, starring Michael Caine, Donald Sutherland, Robert Duvall, Jenny Agutter, Donald Pleasence, Anthony Quayle and Jean Marsh

programme.title: Going in Style (2017)
programme.desc: Joe Harding, Willie Davis and Albert Garner are lifelong friends who have been swindled out of their pension money by a Brooklyn bank. So the seasoned pals decide to steal their cash back in a daring robbery. Director Zach Braff's remake of George Burns's 1979 heist caper, starring Morgan Freeman, Michael Caine and Alan Arkin

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: The life of acting legend Michael Caine, star of movies such as The Ipcress File, The Italian Job, and The Dark Knight. Using rare TV interviews and classic archive clips, this programme tells the story of one of Britain's most successful actors. Narrated by Sylvia Syms

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Treasures
programme.desc: Dan Cruickshank concludes his round-the-world trip with visits to some of Europe's greatest treasures, including the recently destroyed and rebuilt Mostar bridge, symbolically connecting the Christian and Muslim worlds, and the Parthenon in Athens. Italy figures heavily on his travels, as he explores Venice, Rome and Florence in search of marvels of the Roman Empire and the Renaissance - including the Pantheon and the chapel of the Medici princes

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc: Holliday Grainger and Callum Turner star in a six-part crime thriller. Soldier Shaun Emery has his conviction for murder overturned because of flawed evidence, and returns home to Britain a free man. However, when damning CCTV footage of him comes to light, he ends up the subject of another investigation. Newly promoted detective Rachel Carey is assigned to the case, and quickly learns the truth is not as simple as it appears

programme.title: The Capture

programme.title: The Capture

programme.title: My Life
programme.desc: Miyawata is a 15-year old indigenous activist from Winnipeg, Canada, who never hesitates to speak up for what she believes in. Each morning, schools in Canada play the national anthem, and all students are expected to stand. In protest of the injustices that her people have faced throughout the history of Canada, Miyawata sits down instead. But will she be able to persuade the head teacher to change the school’s land rights acknowledgement? Miyawata is also the organiser of school climate strikes in her hometown. The climate movement in Winnipeg had enormous momentum until Covid hit, and now that the end of the pandemic is in sight, she wants to get the movement going again.

Passionate about highlighting the impact humans have on the planet, Hugh focusses on single-use plastics and why they are so unsustainable. He offers advice on how to reduce, reuse and recycle more effectively and how we can all make small changes to live more sustainably.

programme.title: Out of This World
programme.desc: In this episode, Dr Maggie reveals that no matter how much you plan, prepare and practise for space travel, things can sometimes go wrong. Dr Maggie’s star guest is Professor David Southwood CBE, who was responsible for getting the European Space Agency’s Beagle 2 Lander onto Mars. However, it didn’t go to plan – so what did he learn when things went wrong? And Dr Maggie answers viewers’ space questions and counts down the top five greatest achievements that you won’t have heard of! Buckle up, it’s time to go Out Of This World!

programme.desc: DI Mooney and the team become embroiled in the mysterious world of faith healing when a blind woman dies while being treated by renowned healer Steadman King. When it turns out the victim was poisoned, all eyes turn to Steadman and his cup of holy water. But how could the prime suspect have carried out the deed in front of an audience without anyone noticing? Meanwhile, JP is put through his paces when Pico the police dog joins the team on a week-long trial, and Florence tries to recreate some of Jack's home comforts

programme.title: The Wedding Planner (2001)

They spend a magical night together and all seems perfect, but her dreams of him becoming her husband suffer a setback when she discovers she has already been hired to organise his marriage to another woman. Will true love find a way? Director Adam Shankman's romantic comedy, starring Jennifer Lopez, Matthew McConaughey, Bridgette Wilson-Sampras, Justin Chambers and Joanna Gleason

programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team of experts bring four treasured family heirlooms back to life. Peter Coxon is next to arrive, hoping the teamwork of Steve Fletcher and Dominic Chinea can provide a speedy recovery to a favourite childhood toy, a tin speed boat. Drama, starring Kris Marshall and Sally Bretton

Later, the final auction in Leicestershire, sees broken pineapples, legless glass ladies, mystery board games and an antique pub table - but which items will make the duo some money?

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Intrepid team members Christine, Elaine, Karen and Katie compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat

programme.title: B&B by the Sea
programme.desc: Richard Blackwood checks in to the retreat, and soon finds himself tasked with making some chorizo for a French-inspired supper. The B&B's resident chef Alex takes the actor and comedian to meet a local pig farmer with a speciality for charcuterie to help him in his mission. The next day, host Sharon has a special task in mind for her guest. He might be known for his sharp wit, but Sharon wants Richard to sharpen his skills working with a local artisan producer. Can he handle the heat of the blacksmiths forge?

programme.title: Beyond Paradise
programme.desc: The peaceful community of Shipton Abbott is rocked when beloved painting the Solo Mare disappears in a seemingly impossible heist while plans are in motion for its appearance at an exhibition. The theft is even more perplexing given the artwork was under the guard of PC Kelby Hartford at the time. Kelby feels responsible and Humphrey pulls out all the stops to recover the priceless piece. Drama, starring Kris Marshall and Sally Bretton

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: DI Mooney and the team become embroiled in the mysterious world of faith healing when a blind woman dies while being treated by renowned healer Steadman King. When it turns out the victim was poisoned, all eyes turn to Steadman and his cup of holy water. But how could the prime suspect have carried out the deed in front of an audience without anyone noticing? Meanwhile, JP is put through his paces when Pico the police dog joins the team on a week-long trial, and Florence tries to recreate some of Jack's home comforts

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: The second of two compilations of highlights from the recent series. Among the guests featured are Tom Hanks, Cate Blanchett, Austin Butler, Michelle Yeoh, Hugh Jackman, Naomi Ackie, Brendan Fraser, Judi Dench, Jamie Dornan, Kate Winslet, Lizzo and Margot Robbie

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Rugby union player Danny Cipriani, W Series World Champion Jamie Chadwick, former Sunderland striker Kevin Phillips and Commonwealth gold medal-winning weightlifter Zoe Smith join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: The Wedding Planner (2001)
programme.desc: San Francisco wedding planner Mary Fiore organises other people's nuptials but has never had much luck in love. One day she is swept off her feet by handsome doctor Steve Edison. They spend a magical night together and all seems perfect, but her dreams of him becoming her husband suffer a setback when she discovers she has already been hired to organise his marriage to another woman. Will true love find a way? Director Adam Shankman's romantic comedy, starring Jennifer Lopez, Matthew McConaughey, Bridgette Wilson-Sampras, Justin Chambers and Joanna Gleason

programme.title: Newsround
programme.desc: The war in Ukraine is the biggest in Europe since World War II. Millions of children have been forced to leave their homes to escape the fighting, but many either others couldn’t or didn’t. Hearing from just some of those who are living through war, this film lets the children caught in the conflict tell their stories in their own words. Covering fear, loss, strength and hope, they detail the life-changing events of the war and the impact it is having on their day-to-day life. They share their experiences of surviving attacks from the air, being forced to live for weeks at a time in bomb shelters, and their towns and villages becoming occupied by Russian soldiers. Ricky Boleto finds out how the children are coping with living in a country at war.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: PG Tips and Lipton's are world-famous tea brands and an undercover investigation reveals that women working on plantations producing them are being pressured to have sex with their bosses in return for work. The report focuses on plantations that have been owned for years by two British companies - Unilever and James Finlay and Company - who between them have produced half the tea drunk in the UK. Reporter Tom Odula has spoken to dozens of women who say they have been sexually assaulted or harassed, while undercover footage reveals how one young woman was targeted for sex at a job interview

programme.title: Talking Movies
programme.desc: Talking Movies reports from Los Angeles ahead of Hollywood's biggest night of the year - the Oscars. With the sci-fi action comedy Everything Everywhere All at Once leading the Oscars race, the preview programme hears from its Asian star Michelle Yeoh and looks at how this has been a record year for Asian actors in terms of nominations. With Steven Spielberg's semi-autobiographical The Fabelmans up for seven Oscars, Talking Movies also features an interview with the acclaimed Hollywood director on why the film is so important to him. Other big names whose movies are in the running include Cate Blanchett, Brendan Fraser and director James Cameron - they each discuss their Oscar-nominated work with presenter Tom Brook. Also, India's prolific film industry is often overlooked by the Academy, but this year the country has picked up a best original song nomination for its epic action international blockbuster RRR as well as getting recognition in the documentary feature and documentary shor

programme.title: Our World
programme.desc: In February 2022, a video emerged of a young Afghan woman screaming for help whilst her door was being kicked in by the Taliban. Little is known about what took place after - where was she taken and for what reason? Yalda Hakim travels to Afghanistan after gaining access to her and her family after they were released from prison and as they plot their escape from Afghanistan to Europe.

programme.desc: Tha sgioba CBBC ALBA a’ toirt thugainn na sgeulachdan agus na tachartasan as eagalaiche a th’ ann an eachdraidh na h-Alba. Anns a’ phrògram seo tha sinn a’ faighinn sealladh air beatha Màiri Banrigh na h-Alba agus Ellen a’ cur roimhpe fhèin aon latha a chuir seachad mar Mhàiri. Dè dh’fhaodadh a dhol ceàrr? The CBBC ALBA team brings us some of the scariest stories in Scottish history. In this episode, we’re given a rare insight into the life of Mary Queen of Scots as Ellen decides to become Mary for just one day. On her own head be it!

programme.title: Joni Mitchell
programme.desc: A portrait of the Canadian protest singer, who arrived in 1960s America and began to make a name for herself in folk clubs - but was not afraid of criticising the country that adopted her, a trait that would define her life and career

programme.title: Dhan Uisge
programme.desc: Calum Maclean challenges himself to swim in icy waters to Lochindorb Castle, which is a scenic old ruinous castle on an island in the loch

programme.title: Mach à Seo!
programme.desc: Ramsay MacMahon sails to the Isle of Eigg, now in its 25th year of community ownership, to find out how this has shaped the island. He passes by the house that JRR Tolkien once stayed in, visits a beach where the sand makes strange squeaking noises underfoot and hikes up Eigg’s iconic an Sgùrr, a striking volcanic ridge, for views across the archipelago and to Skye

programme.title: Alba Today
programme.desc: BBC Alba joins Radio nan Gàidheal, the BBC's Gaelic language radio service

programme.title: Alba Today
programme.desc: BBC Alba joins Radio nan Gàidheal, the BBC's Gaelic language radio service

programme.title: Treubh an Tuathanais (Big Barn Farm)
programme.desc: When Caoimheann the owl, the wisest animal Eachann has ever met, comes to visit the farm, the Bunch want to challenge him to a quiz

programme.title: Pip & Posy
programme.desc: After Pip and Posy compete in a wheelbarrow race, they aren’t in a good frame of mind with one another. How will they get over this?

programme.title: Sionnach agus Maigheach (Fox & Hare)
programme.desc: Brush decides to start a ladies club and invites all the ladies of the forest for brunch. When Fox and Tusk try to join in, dressed as ladies, Brush soon discovers their identity

programme.title: Beathaichean a' Bocadaich
programme.desc: Sophie looks through her magic binoculars to find out how animals boogie

programme.title: AH-AH/No-No
programme.desc: AH-AH and MacÌomhair have started collecting things but this causes arguments between them. But they eventually realise nothing is more important than friendship

programme.title: Peataichean/Pets
programme.desc: Eilidh Cormack meets Angus and his four cats

programme.title: Stòiridh
programme.desc: Angela MacEachen reads Seo Mi Dhachaigh, Mo Bhean-phòsta, written and illustrated by Jarvis and translated into Gaelic by Morag Stewart

programme.title: Aithne air Ainmhidhean (All About Animals)
programme.desc: Interesting facts about members of the animal kingdom, focusing on the humpback whale

programme.title: Damhan & Durrag/Pipas & Douglas
programme.desc: There’s a lot of noisy squealing going on
An insight into Kenny MacRae's life at 12 years old

programme.title: Geamaichean Gorach
programme.desc: Coinneach has another silly idea

programme.title: Ronia, Nighean a' Mheirlich/Ronja, the Robber's Daughter
programme.desc: Lobhis awaits Ronia and Biorc at the cave. She has asked Ronia to return home but Ronia refuses, as she wants to stay with her brother, Biorc

programme.title: An Là (News)
programme.desc: Local, national and international news and information from BBC Alba

programme.title: Dàn
programme.desc: Poet Peter MacKay talks about poetry and its importance. He discusses how Lewis poet Iain Crichton Smith has influenced him and reads Tha thu air Aigeann M'Inntinn

programme.title: Machair
programme.desc: Gaelic soap based on the Isle of Lewis

programme.title: Fraochy Bay
programme.desc: Times are tough for Fraochy Bay's sweet-toothed residents, as the town's excessive sugar consumption leads to the passing of new laws and the introduction of prohibition

programme.title: Fianais
programme.desc: John Morrison talks to Michael Buchanan about the Libyan Revolution, which led to the overthrow of Colonel Muammar Gaddafi. Michael was working for the BBC and reported on the fighting in March 2011

programme.title: Golf: Mun Cuairt Alba
programme.desc: Gary Dingwall shows how to play the challenging 14th hole at Royal Dornoch, called ‘Foxy’, and professional coach Keil Beveridge demonstrates his weekly top playing tip

programme.title: Is Mise an Teanga
programme.desc: Documentary about the Gaelic language, with contributions by contemporary poets from the Outer Hebrides, Dublin, Connemara, West Belfast and Glasgow

programme.title: Seirm
programme.desc: Highlights from Seirm with Yellow House Band, Brendan Begley, Dónal O'Connor and Tim Edey

programme.title: Trom
programme.desc: After Ragnar's last warning, a new discovery reveals who the true perpetrator is. Hannis takes drastic steps to catch the killer. In Danish and Faroese

programme.title: ALT
programme.desc: Including a live performance from Astrid, harpist Rachel Newton sings a Gaelic song accompanied by fiddle and percussion, and Eddi Reader chats about her love of Robert Burns

programme.title: Seirm

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

Amy agrees to meet Summer, only to find Aaron and his friend are there too and Beth offers an olive branch to Kirk

As they face overwhelming loss, Jenn must gain the trust of the Metcalf family to help Manning and the MIU uncover the truth of what has happened. Starring Marsha Thomason, Kerrie Taylor and Karl Davies

programme.title: Paxman: Putting Up with Parkinson's
programme.desc: Jeremy Paxman's story of living with Parkinson's disease, as the presenter allows cameras into his life for the first time since his formal diagnosis 18 months ago. He speaks to other high-profile people living with Parkinson's, meets Jane Asher, the President of Parkinson's UK, attends an English National Ballet therapy dance class and learns to play bowls. He also meets experts who are at the leading edge of research, including observing a brain dissection - as well as the woman who, scientists believe, can smell the presence of the disease in others. Narrated by Rebecca Front

programme.title: On Assignment
programme.desc: Peter Smith reports from Turkey near the epicentre of the deadly earthquake that has cost tens of thousands of lives, and Rageh Omaar travels to South Africa to uncover the truth about the country's devastating energy crisis. Elsewhere, Rebecca Barry is in New York, another US state that has made recreational use of cannabis legal in recent months, as it prepare to hand out its first licenses to sell the drug

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: A few of the locals enjoy a big night out, where Victoria tries to set Ethan up - only to realise that the prospective man is actually interested in her. Amy comes to a decision, and Leyla confronts Callum - will she regret it?

programme.title: Tonight
programme.desc: The UK has the largest regulated online gambling sector in the world, and now with the market seeing more and more online products and games of all kinds, people can gamble using their mobile phones and from the comfort of their own homes, at work or even on the go. Now eighteen years on from the last major gambling legislation, the Government is consulting on new reform to gambling laws, but will it be enough to protect consumers? Paul Brand examines the devastating impact gambling can have on people's lives, and speaks to the people coping with the impact of gambling harms and hears from those running Britain's treatment services as they struggle with rising demand

programme.title: Cold Case Detectives
programme.desc: A specialist team of detectives revisit unsolved criminal investigations, beginning with the 60-year-old case of the murder of six-year-old Carol Ann Stephens. Using the latest developments in forensic science to uncover new evidence, the team revisit old crime scenes, interview new witnesses and re-examine crucial pieces of evidence in the case

programme.title: Unbelievable Moments Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong presents a selection of extraordinary eyewitness footage filmed by members of the public, including the heart-stopping story of a man who took a pleasure flight on a hang-glider, but the pilot forgot to attach him. Two passengers on board the Viking Sky cruise ship that suffered engine failure in rough seas just off the coast of Norway recount how they were left fearing for their lives, while a heroic cop throws the rulebook out of the window when trying to save a baby's life on the roadside

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: An ex-soldier visits Aidensfield on holiday and his daughter strikes up a relationship with a local farm hand. Greengrass finds himself the owner of stolen cigarettes and Jo receives tragic news. Rural drama, with Bill Maynard and Nick Berry

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: Julia McKenzie returns as the sleuthing spinster in the first of three murder mysteries. While staying at a hotel in the Caribbean, Miss Marple investigates the death of a fellow guest, refusing to believe he died of a heart attack. With the help of a business tycoon she sets about finding the real cause of the man's demise, and is soon drawn into a web of deceit and dark magic. Adapted by Charlie Higson and co-starring Antony Sher, Robert Webb, Montserrat Lombard, Daniel Rigby, Hermione Norris, MyAnna Buring, Warren Brown and Oliver Ford Davies

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: An otherwise quiet nightshift is disrupted when a group of young American airmen are arrested for trespassing at the local quarry and brought to the station. When one of the airmen collapses and dies, Geordie and Will must try and work out how he could have been murdered in plain sight, in police custody. Drama set in the 1950s, starring Robson Green

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: As the day of Leonard's trial dawns, Will and Geordie are called upon to investigate an audacious robbery from a bank security van in Cambridge, which has had tragic repercussions for an innocent bystander. Questioning the apprehended suspect Malcy Smith and the bank security guard Wilson Black, Will and Geordie have a hunch that something about their account of events doesn't quite add up. Drama set in the 1950s, starring Robson Green

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Karen tentatively looks forward to seeing her mother for the first time in 25 years, but unfortunately the reunion doesn't turn out as she hoped. Relations are hardly any more harmonious elsewhere, as Oscar continues to give Cheryl the cold shoulder _ leading to a devastating accident at home. Popular drama, starring Leslie Ash and Philip Middlemiss

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: A pregnant schoolgirl runs away after confiding in Anna, deciding to have her baby by herself on the moors, and David tires of pandering to Karen, suspecting her mother is the real reason behind the mystery illness. Chris refuses to give up on his relationship with Beth, despite her plans to finish their affair, and Vic becomes riled by Lucy's girlie chats with Jess, finding it hard to accept that his daughter is growing up. Drama, starring Leslie Ash and Philip Middlemiss

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Shadrach agrees not to sue Marlon, Terry and Dawn nervously await news on the health risk to their unborn child, and preparations for Jean's christening get under way

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Syd tries to resist Chloe's advances. Jean's christening proves a rousing success, but the future looks bleak for parents-to-be Dawn and Terry

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Richard sets his sights on relieving Rita of her savings. Lillian leaves the Rovers of her own accord and Blanche takes a nasty tumble down the stairs while home alone

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Archie finds Blanche lying motionless at the bottom of the stairs. Norris tries to warn Rita about Richard, and Kevin springs more than one surprise on Sally on her birthday

programme.title: Man About the House
programme.desc: Chrissy and Robin spend an evening at home alone - and the absence of a chaperone allows the trainee chef's amorous side to surface. Comedy, starring Richard O'Sullivan

programme.title: Man About the House
programme.desc: Robin comes home with a puppy, to Chrissy's dismay. Flat-share comedy, with Richard O'Sullivan, Sally Thomsett and Paula Wilcox

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: While attending a conference, David receives a job offer that seems impossible to refuse _ will he leave Simon in the lurch? Karen anxiously prepares to meet her estranged mother for lunch, and Chris learns the truth about Beth's marital status. Anna treats a man whose health is suffering due to his job in a textile factory, but ends up equally concerned about his wife's welfare as she struggles to look after her husband and two lazy teenagers. Drama, starring Leslie Ash and Philip Middlemiss

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: A memorial service for Peggy brings memories of happy times flooding back to her family and friends. Vic puts on a brave face, while Lucy's poignant speech brings a tear to everyone's eye. Anna becomes increasingly worried about depressed widower Ted, and following a hunch, heads to the factory to find him perched on the roof _ ready to jump. Dick and Oscar are surprised by Cheryl's return and a heartfelt confession provides an important breakthrough in their bid to be happily united

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Aircraft manufacturer Lord Mayfield hosts a party to trap a woman suspected of being a spy for the Germans. Fearing events might not go according to plan, Lady Mayfield decides to summon the famous Belgian detective to keep an eye on proceedings. Starring David Suchet, with John Stride and Phyllida Law

programme.title: Heartbeat

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Richard vows to make Norris pay for talking Rita out of investing her savings. Sally struggles to comprehend Kevin's offer and Blanche is thrilled to receive a visit from Archie

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A stately home is turned into a theme park celebrating the work of local horror writer Ellis Bell, but the opening ceremony is marred by the death of a film star. Barnaby and Troy's investigation uncovers the secrets within an eccentric family, and a centuries-old village feud comes under the spotlight. Murder mystery, written by Alan Plater and guest starring Beth Goddard

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Isobel suggests using Downton as a place of convalescence following a distressing incident at the village hospital. Shell-shocked new valet Lang arrives as William gets his call-up papers, and Carson strives to keep standards high, but suffers a panic attack in front of the family. Lady Rosamund is eager to unearth Lavinia and Carlisle's secret after overhearing them arguing, and romance blossoms for both Edith and Mary. Costume drama, starring Jim Carter, Samantha Bond and Cal Macaninch

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nick helps a woman claiming she is being harassed by a mysterious stalker, and discovers the culprit is closer to home than anticipated. programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The successful businesswoman behind an empire of beauty salons throws a lavish party on board a boat on the River Tyne - only for her sister to be found dead in the water. Vera's investigation uncovers the possibility that the victim may have been in an abusive relationship - but may also have been about to bring a terrible secret to light that threatened her entire family

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: When the leader of a student CND group, Rachel Bromilow, falls to her death from a college building while staging a daring protest, Will and Geordie discover her demise is not as accidental as it first appears. programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Election fever grips Skelthwaite, but Simon finds his opponent more formidable and devious than the weedy kid he used to bully at school. Karen's mother Linda is becoming a burden at the Buckley home, but a rethink is needed when it emerges she has a serious medical problem, and David finds himself embroiled in Conrad Walker's spurious business empire with no hope of backing out. Meanwhile, Beth uncovers Anita's beauty secrets and plans to make things difficult for estranged husband Stewart

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: A good-looking newcomer sets hearts a-flutter among the women of Skelthwaite, but behind the handsome exterior lies a troubled mind. Meanwhile, Linda reveals she needs an urgent operation that will cost 10,000 pounds, and son-in-law David vows to get her the money, but may not be entirely truthful about her illness. Drama, starring Leslie Ash, Lesley Dunlop, Tony Haygarth and Lee Warburton

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: An actress engaged to marry a foreign prince becomes the police's number one suspect in the murder of a shady producer. Desperate to ensure she escapes prosecution, her wealthy fiance asks Poirot to catch the real killer. Unfortunately, the celebrated detective ends up concluding she has lied - or is an accomplice. David Suchet stars, with Niamh Cusack, Abigail Cruttenden and Sean Pertwee

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Danny grows suspicious of Ollie's mood swings. Andy feels the strain of making ends meet, and Bob is thrilled by Dawn's news

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Maxine persuades Doreen to patch things up with husband Derek. Les's garden makeover leaves Ashley seething, and Audrey invites Archie to the wedding

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A book dealer is found drowned, having seemingly committed suicide in despair at having sunk all his cash in a local inventor's revolutionary new transport system - but the discovery of a second body makes it clear that there is a murderer at large. Detective drama, starring John Nettles, Daniel Casey, Kate Buffery and Richard Todd

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: The wounded officers arrive at Downton and Matthew suggests he bring General Sir Herbert Strutt to inspect the new convalescent home - but Branson decides to spoil the visit after failing his army medical. Meanwhile, William's return results in an awkward surprise for Daisy, and Violet and Rosamund discover Lavinia's past misdeeds. Costume drama, starring Dan Stevens, Allen Leech, Thomas Howes, Maggie Smith and Zoe Boyle

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Jo is concerned that her father is not managing without his wife and emotions boil over after a car accident. Meanwhile, Greengrass's brother arrives in the village

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: New neighbours look set to disturb the tranquillity of Portwenn, upsetting the locals with their unconventional lifestyle and even managing to gatecrash an intimate dinner between Martin and Louisa. Meanwhile, a car vandal strikes the village - but agoraphobic village copper PC Penhale is too scared to leave the station and investigate. Martin Clunes stars

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Louisa faces off with love rival Carrie in a battle for Martin's affections, and romance is in the air for Aunt Joan, who gains an admirer in the form of Edward. Elsewhere, Al makes a surprise reappearance and PC Penhale celebrates his birthday. Martin Clunes stars, with Joe Absolom and Louise Delamere

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: When a successful music producer is murdered, Geordie finds himself implicated in the investigation. Forced to consider whether his army buddy Johnny could be the killer, Geordie has to finally face up to some traumatic events from his own past. Meanwhile, Will is on thin ice with the Bishop, who wants to discuss his future in Grantchester. Could both of their jobs be on the line - and can he save himself as well as his best friend?

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: The summer of 1959 finds the wedding season in full swing in the Cambridgeshire village of Grantchester. Among the Reverend Will Davenport's many brides-to-be is Adele Fitzgerald, who lives on the once-splendid, but now declining Fitzgerald Estate with her green-fingered spinster sister Maude. The body of a dead man is found in the grounds and is quickly identified as the sisters' errant brother Lord Edmund Fitzgerald, who has been living an itinerant life travelling the world since the war. Will and DI Geordie Keating find themselves at odds with Geordie's new boss DCI Elliot Wallace and DC Larry Peters in viewing the death as a murder. As Will and Geordie investigate the Fitzgerald family history, they find themselves looking into Edmund's own romantic past. Drama set in the 1950s, starring Robson Green, Tom Brittney, Tessa Peake-Jones and Emma Cunniffe

programme.desc: The team drives to Kalgoorlie, the gold mining capital of Australia, to salvage a 10-tonne gold dry-blower that has been sitting idle for months and is costing its owner hundreds of thousands of dollars in lost revenue. programme.desc: A £30,000 consignment of mercury is stolen and the squad is bemused when the prime suspect comes up with a cast-iron alibi - he was in the company of his 'mistress' hours before his planned wedding ceremony.
