programme.title: Smarty Pants
programme.desc: Animated comedy series about three kids and their missions from the Great Book of Cooldom. Our heroes notice that all the coolest dudes are always surrounded by girls, so they decide to go looking for a girl who wants to hang out with them - after encountering several refusals, Simone finally accepts! However, Simone is no pushover, and through her daring and cunning actions, she teaches the boys a lesson about their macho prejudices by hugely exaggerating all the cliches they have about girls.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. Magoo, in the park, believes he's in the Amazon rainforest. Finding Fizz's plush toy, he mistakes it for the legendary idol of the Nanoshrimp. He decides to return the object to its rightful place on its plinth, before sunset.

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd is excited to attend the 'hottest party there is' behind the oven after Biggo puts a pizza on - 'hotter' equals 'happier' for Lloyd, but as the street party heats up and insects start to leave, Lloyd insists that there's no such thing as 'too hot'...

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. When Lloyd starts behaving very oddly - flying into walls, sitting on his sister, seeing multiples of everything, eating a dishcloth - his family start to suspect that something may be wrong with his senses.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: George finds a computer called Val but Val has a mind of her own. Soon she's set about uploading embarrassing videos to social media.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Fuzzypeg eats the Spuds' fish supper and Dave has to catch another. Things look up when he hooks something, but it turns out to be a whale.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Monsters and ghouls get in the way of the Scooby gang's adventures as they travel and spend time together in the summer

programme.title: Scooby-Doo and Guess Who?
programme.desc: Jump into the Mystery Machine for more comedic mystery-solving adventures with Scooby and the gang. Mystery Inc. encounters a giant gorilla on a rampage while bumping into Jessica Biel in a jungle.

programme.title: Buck and Buddy
programme.desc: A new food source lands in the middle of Toxic Pea Soup Lake, and the battle is on to get there first.

programme.title: Scooby-Doo and Guess Who?
programme.desc: Shaggy and Scooby take the gang to meet their good friend actor and comedian Kenan Thompson.

programme.title: Tata and Kuma
programme.desc: Madcap animated comedy. Tata is always an obstacle to the Mouse Commandos, who are always looking for food in the waste bins - when a giant snot monster appears to the sleeping Tata, its terrible attack overpowers Tata. However, the scary monster immediately kneels down when he sees the Mouse Commandos...

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: Animated series based on the DC Comics fictional superhero team the Teen Titans. The Titans fly to Los Angeles but end up in San Pedro, where Berto tells them about villainous longshoreman Carl Sanpedro.

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: Animated series based on the DC Comics fictional superhero team the Teen Titans. When Carl Sanpedro strikes in Jamaica, the Titans take off for the Caribbean

programme.title: DC Super Hero Girls
programme.desc: Leslie Willis, the meanest girl in school, becomes a social media sensation by posting mean-spirited videos on her MetropoVids channel

programme.title: Craig of the Creek
programme.desc: When an intense game of 'The Ground is Lava' breaks out, Craig must carefully traverse the Creek to save his sister.

programme.title: LEGO Monkie Kid
programme.desc: Animated series following a young teenager on a mission to save the world. Mei is a member of the Dragon Family and a descendant of the Dragon of the West - when Mei is asked to house-sit for her parents, MK begs to come along. General Ironclad, one of the Demon Bull King's minions, hears that the family will be gone and realises that there is an opening to infiltrate the famed Dragon Temple House and steal the legendary Dragon Blade, but Mei defends her home and birth right to wield the sword.

programme.title: LEGO Monkie Kid
programme.desc: Animated series following a young teenager on a mission to save the world. Pigsy and Tang are taken hostage by the Spider Queen when they go looking for ingredients, so Sandy, Monkie Kid, Mei, and Mo take their new boat down into the sewers to free their friends.

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: When Alan is on space junk duty, one of the pieces of debris turns out to be a heat-seeking SAT-MINE that activates and locks onto TB3's heat signature. Back on Earth, Lady Penelope and Parker sneak into a top-secret storage facility to find the mine's deactivation code

programme.title: Overlord and the Underwoods
programme.desc: When Willow's girls' soccer team is overlooked, Overlord decides to get involved - for the other team. Flower takes it upon herself to help R0-FL follow her own interests

programme.title: Drop Dead Weird
programme.desc: Comedy drama following the adventures of an Australian family who move to an isolated seaside village in western Ireland, with the parents having a secret to hide

programme.title: Makeaway Takeaway
programme.desc: A comedy arts and crafts show for six to 11-year-olds and presented by comedian Bec Hill. The Takeaway is in chaos and Bec needs help organising her paperwork, so she orders a surprising solution... some bubble wrap inspires a Takeaway technique with a 'pop', and a customer has trouble saying goodbye to their favourite pair of old shoes - Bec also makes her mark with a giant pen with just three ingredients, and she creates something fantastic out of plastic for a surfing coach.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Game show that sees teenage presenter Danny Murphy take on some of the craziest dares, from rock climbing to racing a hovercraft! In this episode, Danny needs all his strength as he faces a 14-metre rock climb, but will he reach the Dare Master flag at the top?

programme.title: Ted's Top Ten
programme.desc: Comedy series following the misadventures of Ted and his school friends and family. Halloween has gripped the Noonan household as Stu plans for his party spooktacular and Lani's going trick-or-treating with her two daughters - things are complicated, however, when Jada's invited out by her father on the same day that Ted finally secures a date with Rosie Barnes, only for the date to clash not only with Stu's party, but a trick-or-treat session with Penny too. Can Ted be in three places at once?

programme.title: The Epic Tales of Captain Underpants
programme.desc: Animated comedy featuring two trouble-making young friends who re-imagine their grumpy headmaster as a superhero looking to fight crime and save their city. In a last-ditch effort to save the summer, the boys convince Krupp to send the kids on a camping trip in the woods - the boys try to rout it, but they discover that it's less fun than they expected. That's the least of their worries, though, when Meaner - in a freak accident - melds with Melvin's VR helmet to become the wizard Borelock...

programme.title: LEGO Ninjago
programme.desc: Peace has come to Ninjago, and the Ninja are taking a break from training to play video games. After they are scolded by Sensei Wu, Nya comes running in, announcing that Lord Garmadon has returned

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. JC accuses Mo of triggering a huge water fight in the cafeteria, but he's the one who actually started it. As punishment, Mo is assigned to clean the most horrible classroom in the school, so he decides to ask the Sceptre for the power to take on the appearance of whoever he wishes - why? He plans on visiting the principal looking like JC to confess 'his' crime, but the power doesn't just give him JC's appearance - it gives him his personality too!

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Mr Brick has been on edge for several days, handing out punishments left and right and piling on the assignments - what's bitten him? The answer comes in just two words - Mrs Uptight! She is the regional head of the educational project The School of the Future and is visiting the school - which is acting as a pilot scheme - to see Mr Brick give a demonstration. When Mr Brick flees the demonstration, Mo and Sam have to find a solution to get Mr Brick to return.

MK is trapped in the nefarious Calabash, an ancient magical device wielded by Jin and Yin, the Gold and Silver Demons... can he break out of it?

programme.title: LEGO Monkie Kid
programme.desc: Animated series following a young teenager on a mission to save the world. Everyone in the city is abuzz with talk of an upcoming street race that will grant the winner immortality - Mei and MK decide to enter the race, but a disagreement causes them to compete against each other. Their frustration boils over, causing them both to crash and the Demon Bull family to take the lead - when this happens, Mei and MK work together in order to create a new race car and win the race.

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: The Tracy brothers and their friends at International Rescue set out to foil the nefarious plots of the evil Hood. programme.title: Makeaway Takeaway
programme.desc: A comedy arts and crafts show for six to 11-year-olds and presented by comedian Bec Hill. Bec is expecting a very special visitor to the Takeaway - her Grandma! Bec also comes up with a green-fingered make that doesn't need watering with just three ingredients, and an art teacher gets a colourful surprise!

programme.title: Dare Master

programme.desc: Animated comedy featuring two trouble-making young friends who re-imagine their grumpy headmaster as a superhero looking to fight crime and save their city. Around the campfire, George and Harold tell a ghost story about Gumbalina Toothington, a terrifying 18th-century dentist who roams the woods, but when Melvin makes a machine to create a real version of Gumbalina, he unleashes a real-life ghost dentist who threatens the camp with dental hygiene.

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Horror - Mo forgot to do his art studio homework! He fills the gap in a flash by taking one of his mother's anatomical models to school to pass it off as his own creation. It works, but Selina quickly realises that the foot is missing and warns Mo that he'll be in serious trouble - to make things worse, the model foot is stuffed with Mo's favourite video game, the one that Selina took from him and hid! Mo therefore has to break into Brick's office in order to get it back.

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Sam is due to take part in an eloquence contest whose prize was won by her mother and her grandmother when they were young - the pressure is on Sam, and that makes her unbelievably tense. Sam realises that she is lost for words when she feels stressed - to avoid catastrophe, she asks the Sceptre for the power of repartee. The half-power does provide her with snappy answers, but they are extremely caustic, and that's just the start of her problems...

programme.desc: Animated comedy series. Angry, Mo wants to get rid of such publicity right now, so he summons the power to control advertising, but he realises that he is forced to advertise everything that he touches at half-power and ends up managing to close the school.

programme.title: 50/50 Heroes
programme.desc: Animated comedy series. While searching for a game console that Selina has confiscated, Mo finds two tickets for the 'Isaac the Psychic' show, but only one child's ticket! Lenny feels sorry for his buddy, but when he tries to console him, he makes things worse without meaning to. Mo is eaten up with paranoia as he's convinced that Sam has always been their mother's favourite - to make sure that he's the one that Selina takes, Mo invokes the power to be the favourite of whoever he wants...

programme.title: Smarty Pants
programme.desc: Animated comedy series about three kids and their missions from the Great Book of Cooldom. Zoe is having slumber parties at everyone's houses and giving them grades - if she has fun, you get the 'approved by Zoe' label, but if it doesn't work out, it's the humiliation of the century for you... JP has everything ready to make Zoe happy and impress her - dinner, decorations, activities, but Zoe has decided that her next pyjama party will be at Pedro's instead... so it's tough luck for JP, then!

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. Fizz discovers the hidden dimension where lost socks go. He invents a machine to bring them back, but when they appear, they take on a life of their own and escape the Fizzlab. Magoo thinks he's witnessing an invasion of mutant caterpillars.

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. In the first of this two-part special, Kathy examines getting older and how she feels about what is to come in later life, she learns from 85 year-old model Bridget and a 70 year-old dominatrix that raging against the realities that come with old age might be the secret to aging disgracefully and with dignity. programme.title: Bronson: Fit to Be Free?

After serving 48 years in prison, he is due to make his case for release at a parole board hearing held in public - one of the first of its kind. This two-part special gives voice to some of his victims, those closest to Bronson, and various members of the criminal justice system to ascertain whether he is fit to be released

programme.title: Dispatches
programme.desc: Throughout this winter a member of an ambulance crew has secretly filmed his daily work. The covert film vividly records him and his colleagues struggling to save lives despite lengthening ambulance delays, and overwhelmed A&E departments that stack patients in corridors without the hospital medical staff available to care for them. The footage and additional case studies uncovered by this programme's makers illustrate how the NHS's apparent failure to properly deal with emergency calls is causing suffering, long-term harm and possibly needless death

programme.title: Secret Life of the Forest
programme.desc: The warm summer days continue in Dalby and Cropton Forests, and cameras capture the forest's youngsters as they investigate their new surroundings, from fawns nervously exploring, to badger cubs appearing out of their setts for the first time and learning how to play-fight with their siblings. Meanwhile at the beaver pond, cameras follow herons as they lurk by the water and stalk their prey

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports

programme.title: The Black Death
programme.desc: Part one of two. Dan Snow and archaeologist Raksha Dave investigate how the Black Death devastated Britain 700 years ago, killing around three million people across the country. In the first edition, Dan heads to Melcombe Regis in Dorset as he traces the spread of the plague and finds out how the disease reached Britain's shores in 1348. At The Old Operating Theatre in London, Raksha witnesses the horrific symptoms of this deadly disease and the terrifying outcome for those who fell victim to it, and also investigates the recent discovery of mass graves beneath a tranquil London square

programme.title: Casualty 24/7: Every Second Counts
programme.desc: It's another busy day for the casualty team with patient numbers unusually high. Sister Rachel is running the shift, and she's under pressure with a shortage of cubicles - to make matters worse, IT systems start to fail across the hospital, causing chaos for patient flow. Urgent treatment is needed for 75-year-old Janet, who's been viciously attacked by a dog and has a large flap of skin hanging from her elbow

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc: PC Andy Doran chases thieves on the run from a shop robbery in Ellesmere Port, where they have reportedly stolen thousands of pounds worth of goods. When the suspect vehicle is finally spotted 70 miles from the crime scene on the M6, Andy and two other patrols must be quick to stop the criminals before they get away

programme.title: Police Raids: Caught by Surprise
programme.desc: The return of the documentary following enforcement agencies carrying out raids across Britain as they take action against fraudsters, counterfeiters and criminals. Trading Standards officers raid more than 20 shipping containers tucked away on an industrial estate in London, uncovering millions of pounds' worth of fake goods, including hi-tech items and knock-off designer accessories

programme.title: The LeoVegas Live Casino Show
programme.desc: Interactive gambling

programme.title: Police: Suspect No 1
programme.desc: After a raid on a cannabis factory, nine people are arrested and it is up to the team at Norwich CID to get to the bottom of which role each suspect played. In the interview room, different stories emerge and the detectives face a daunting challenge to determine who is telling the truth and who is spinning lies

programme.title: Britain's Greatest Bridges
programme.desc: Engineer Rob Bell tells the story behind the design and construction of Isambard Kingdom Brunel's famous bridge over the picturesque Avon gorge at Bristol, and discovers that some people question whether it was entirely the product of his own devising. The bridge remained unfinished in Brunel's lifetime, but when he died in 1859, his friends decided that the bridge should be completed as a memorial, using the chains from another of his suspension bridges that was being demolished

programme.title: Building Britain's Canals
programme.desc: Writer and historian Dan Jones navigates Britain's longest canal to be built by just one company, the Leeds and Liverpool Canal. Built to link the economically booming counties of Yorkshire and Lancashire, this 19th-century superhighway was experimental for the time, and made Liverpool the busiest port in the world. In Burnley, the cotton capital of the 19th century, Dan visits the world's only steam-powered cotton mill, where enough cloth was woven each year to reach to the moon and back two-and-a-half times

programme.title: Isle of Wight: Jewel of the South
programme.desc: Documentary celebrating the breathtaking natural beauty and rich historical heritage of the Isle of Wight, by following the lives of residents whose families have lived there for generations. In Yarmouth, upmarket hotelier Howard Spooner prepares for one of the busiest weeks of the summer, while in Briddlesford, fourth generation farmer Paul Griffin is battling the summer drought. Cameras also follow Helen Butler on one of her regular forays into the island's verdant forests on her quest to save the 3,000 native red squirrels. In Ryde, entertainer Derek Sandy is preparing for his Love Monday entertainment night, which this week sees the final of his island-wide talent competition

programme.title: The Black Death
programme.desc: Part two of two. Dan Snow and archaeologist Raksha Dave investigate how the Black Death devastated Britain 700 years ago, killing around three million people across the country. In the concluding episode, Dan and Raksha pick up the terrifying story of Black Death six months after the first deadly outbreak in Britain 700 years ago. By January 1349, the plague had engulfed southern England, and Britain was now in the grip of the most devastating pandemic in history. As Dan and Raksha explore the spiralling death toll, they reveal how the country was gripped by fear and descended into chaos

programme.title: Ben Fogle & the Lost City

programme.title: Motorway: Hell on the Highway
programme.desc: A panel of drivers and driving experts, including former road police, driving instructors and HGV drivers, react to dashcam footage of jaw-dropping traffic incidents from the UK and worldwide. The panel reveal why they think things ended in catastrophe and what we can do to stop the same from happening to us. In this opening episode, lorries lose their loads and Californian drivers become distracted by a rocket launch

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports

programme.title: Amazing Railway Adventures with Nick Knowles
programme.desc: The presenter experiences the wonders of the world, by train. First, he heads to Mexico, where he travels on a route from the Pacific coastline at Sinaloa through the incredible Copper Canyon to Creel in Chihuahua. Before boarding his train, Nick visits Topolobampo, a coastal port, where freight trains carrying goods to and from container ships join the railway line through the Copper Canyon. Boarding the passenger train next morning, Nick's first stop is the old Spanish fort town of El Fuerte, which claims to be the inspiration for that legendary hero of multiple Hollywood films, Zorro

programme.title: The Killing of JFK: Minute by Minute
programme.desc: A dissection of events around the assassination of President John Kennedy, charting the timelines of head of security Roy Kellerman, Lee Harvey Oswald and Jackie Kennedy. The three perspectives create a multi-layered view of these much-scrutinised days, considering the hard facts and the still fiercely debated unknowns surrounding this historic event. Includes newly released information that J Edgar Hoover knew about Oswald prior to the shooting

programme.title: Conspiracy
programme.desc: Documentary exploring popular conspiracy theories surrounding the Cold War, including how the lies of one man, former head of intelligence for the German army Reinhard Gehlen, moved the world to within hours of nuclear destruction. Theories related to the potential devastation of the 1962 Cuban Missile Crisis are also examined, along with suspicions associated with the assassination of Italy's former prime minister Aldo Morro, who some claim was killed not by communist revolutionists but by a sinister underground army created by Nato

programme.title: First Class vs Economy: Is It Worth It?
programme.desc: Sally Lindsay and Nigel Havers explore different standards of air travel, meeting at the check-in desk to discover which of them is travelling first class and who will be working in economy. The first-class passenger is immediately whisked through the airport to an exclusive lounge for VIP security clearance, while the economy class presenter has to step into the shoes of the airline staff as they load bags, inspect engines, refuel the plane and prep in-flight meals

programme.title: Never Teach Your Wife to Drive
programme.desc: Documentary following three women who are learning how to drive under instruction from their partners, with the drama and mayhem of the lessons putting added strain on their relationships. In Hertfordshire, Becky's tendency to put her foot down on the accelerator and severe lack of spatial awareness leaves Greg stressed out, while John begins by taking Yasmin out for endless spins around a car park in Wigan. In Guisborough, North Yorkshire, Matt's high levels of patience are tested as he teaches his hot-tempered wife Yaveli the rules of the road

programme.title: Peppa Pig

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Blaze-tackling antics with the friendly firefighter who lives in the fictional Welsh rural village of Pontypandy. Follow Sam and his fire station colleagues and fellow villagers in a series of heated challenges and adventures

programme.title: A Town Like Alice (1956)
programme.desc: Second World War PoW Jean Paget is sent on a gruelling forced march between Japanese labour camps, but finds comfort in her friendship with Australian captive Joe Harman. During the journey Joe is caught stealing, tied to a cross and left to die. After the conflict is over, Jean is startled to receive a letter postmarked in Joe's home town of Alice Springs. Jack Lee's drama, based on the novel by Nevil Shute, starring Virginia McKenna, Peter Finch, Takagi and Jean Anderson

programme.title: The Furies (1950)
programme.desc: The daughter of a ruthlessly ambitious cattle baron is divided between her love for one of his enemies and the prospect of taking over the family ranch when he dies. But when the cruel rancher has one of her friends hanged, she begins plotting his downfall. Western from director Anthony Mann, starring Barbara Stanwyck and Walter Huston

programme.title: Ice Cold in Alex (1958)
programme.desc: The crew and passengers of an ambulance become stranded in the Libyan desert and face a perilous journey back to civilisation. Leading the trek is an alcoholic army captain, who vows to remain sober until he has completed the task - but his resolve is threatened by a stranger they rescue who is secretly an enemy spy. Second World War drama, with John Mills, Sylvia Syms, Anthony Quayle and Harry Andrews

programme.title: Little Women (2019)
programme.desc: In 1868, New York City teacher Jo March goes to Mr Dashwood, an editor who agrees to publish a story she has written. She reflects back and forth on her life, telling the story of the March sisters - four young women, each determined to live life on her own terms. Writer/director Greta Gerwig's adaptation of the Louisa May Alcott novel, starring Saoirse Ronan, Emma Watson and Florence Pugh

programme.title: Proxima (2019)
programme.desc: A French engineer sets out on a year-long space mission as her daughter grapples with her impending absence. Drama, starring Eva Green, Zélie Boulant-Lemesle and Matt Dillon

programme.title: Amulet (2020)
programme.desc: A homeless ex-soldier is offered a place to stay at a decaying house inhabited by a young woman and her dying mother. The smitten former trooper soon suspects something sinister is going on. Writer/director Romola Garai's horror, starring Carla Juri, Alec Secareanu, and Imelda Staunton

programme.title: Things to Come (2016)
programme.desc: A high-school philosophy teacher is forced to re-examine her life when her husband leaves her for another woman. Drama, starring Isabelle Huppert, Andre Marcon and Roman Kolinka. In French, German and English

programme.title: Picnic (1955)
programme.desc: A drifter turns up in a small American town looking for a well-off old friend in the hope of borrowing money. However, he causes nothing but trouble for the locals, seducing both his old pal's fiancee and a local schoolteacher. Drama based on William Inge's Pulitzer Prize-winning play, starring William Holden, Cliff Robertson and Kim Novak

programme.title: 7th Cavalry (1956)
programme.desc: An army officer is branded a coward for failing to fight in the Battle of the Little Bighorn, and is unable to convince anyone that official business had detained him. In a bid to repair his damaged reputation, he leads a cavalry detail to retrieve the dead from the battlefield. Western, starring Randolph Scott, Jay C Flippen and Jeanette Nolan

programme.title: All the King's Men (1949)
programme.desc: A small-town senator wins popular support by railing against the corruption of the political establishment and vowing to defend the interests of ordinary working people. However, once in office, he succumbs to greed as readily as those he once so virulently condemned. Political drama, starring Broderick Crawford, Joanne Dru, John Ireland and Mercedes McCambridge

programme.title: Earth vs the Flying Saucers (1956)
programme.desc: Aliens arrive on Earth with an ultimatum - surrender or face death - prompting humanity to pull out all the stops to find a way of defeating the extraterrestrial menace. Sci-fi drama, starring Hugh Marlowe, Joan Taylor, Donald Curtis and Morris Ankrum, with special effects by Ray Harryhausen

programme.title: GI Joe: The Rise of Cobra (2009)
programme.desc: When a powerful experimental weapon is snatched by a mysterious terrorist organisation, two of the soldiers guarding it are recruited into a top-secret military strike force. As they go in search of the stolen technology, they uncover a plot by its creator to take over the world. Action adventure, with Channing Tatum, Sienna Miller and Christopher Eccleston

programme.title: The Godfather Coda: The Death of Michael Corleone (2020)
programme.desc: Twenty years after ordering the murder of his brother, ageing don Michael Corleone is close to fulfilling his dream of severing his family's Mafia ties and gaining legitimacy, but vengeful enemies and the actions of his hot-headed nephew soon draw him back into a life of crime. Francis Ford Coppola's 2020 director's cut of The Godfather: Part III, starring Al Pacino, Andy Garcia, Diane Keaton, Talia Shire, Eli Wallach and Bridget Fonda

programme.title: Room (2015)
programme.desc: A woman who has been held captive for years lives in a single room with her son, who has never experienced life beyond its walls. She resolves to make sure he has a complete and fulfilling life, but after troubling news from her captor, she realises it is imperative they do everything they can to escape. Drama based on Emma Donoghue's novel, starring an Oscar-winning Brie Larson, with Jacob Tremblay, Joan Allen and William H Macy

programme.title: Somers Town (2008)
programme.desc: Troubled youngster Tommo runs away to London where he meets Marek, a shy Polish immigrant who lives with his labourer father in run-down Somers Town. Tommo moves into their small flat, and the pair end up doing odd jobs for an eccentric neighbour and competing for the attention of a French waitress - while trying to keep their escapades a secret from Marek's father. Shane Meadows' comedy drama, starring Thomas Turgoose, Piotr Jagiello and Ireneusz Czop

programme.title: Strategic Air Command (1955)
programme.desc: A pilot relishes the opportunity to return to the baseball pitch once the Second World War is over. However, his sporting career is put on hold when he's drafted back into the US Air Force and given the opportunity to fly a revolutionary new jet. Drama, starring James Stewart, Frank Lovejoy, Barry Sullivan, Alex Nicol and June Allyson

programme.title: The Caine Mutiny (1954)
programme.desc: US Navy officers rebel against their ship's erratic captain during a violent storm at sea, only to face a court martial back on dry land. However, the crew's actions seem to have been justified when evidence questioning the mental stability of their superior is produced. Second World War drama based on Herman Wouk's novel, starring Humphrey Bogart, Jose Ferrer, Fred MacMurray and Van Johnson

programme.title: Annie (1982)
programme.desc: An orphan wins the fatherly affections of a tough-talking billionaire - but the no-good owner of the orphanage and her brother are out to ruin the girl's chances of happiness and make a quick profit in the process. Musical, directed by John Huston, based on the stage play. Starring Aileen Quinn, Albert Finney, Carol Burnett and Tim Curry

programme.title: The Devil Wears Prada (2006)
programme.desc: A woman with dreams of becoming a journalist takes a job as assistant to the editor of a prestigious fashion magazine - a position that should guarantee a bright future if she succeeds. Unfortunately, she has just signed up to work for the boss from hell, whose cruel personality and outrageous demands make her life a nightmare. Comedy drama, with Meryl Streep, Anne Hathaway, Stanley Tucci and Emily Blunt

programme.title: The Revenant (2015)
programme.desc: A frontiersman leading a hunting party through the wilderness is mauled by a bear, and a travelling companion who pledged to stay with him until help comes kills his son and leaves him for dead. Against all odds, the wounded man survives his injuries and embarks on a gruelling quest for revenge that takes him through a harsh landscape. Western, starring an Oscar-winning Leonardo DiCaprio, with Tom Hardy and Domhnall Gleeson

programme.title: Seven Psychopaths (2012)
programme.desc: A writer struggling to complete the script for a movie about psychopathic killers turns to his criminal friends for advice. He ends up getting more than he bargained for when the small-time crooks kidnap a dog that belongs to a gangster, putting all their lives in danger. Comedy thriller, starring Colin Farrell, Sam Rockwell, Christopher Walken and Woody Harrelson

programme.title: Far North (2007)
programme.desc: A woman is driven from her homeland and forced to live an isolated existence with her adopted daughter in the Arctic wilderness. However, their endless solitude is broken when a wounded soldier appears one day from nowhere. The women take him back to their tent - but the newcomer sows seeds of discord, stirring up conflict between the two women. Drama, with Michelle Yeoh, Sean Bean and Michelle Krusiec

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Mercedes holds an intervention for two warring friends. Meanwhile, a plea hearing prompts true feelings to rise to the surface

programme.title: Hollyoaks

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay checks in to the River Rock Inn in Milford, Pennsylvania, where owner Ken Pisciotta is struggling to attract guests and battling huge debts. He has all but given up and his constant negativity is rubbing off on the staff. Can Gordon get this establishment back on track before Ken loses everything?

programme.desc: Dinner reservations have been secured at a plush restaurant, but Gloria is taking forever to get ready and an almighty sartorial crisis strikes when Mitch and Cam don the exact same outfit. programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Manny is not happy when Gloria hires a male nanny and it turns out Jay isn't that keen either. Phil is worried about his dad Frank, and embarks on a mission to help him get his groove back, while Pepper pops by to plan Mitch and Cam's wedding, but when talk turns to unicorns, the pair attempt to rein their pal in. Nathan Lane guest stars

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: The precinct's staff prepare for an unusually busy night as the neighbourhood gets into the Halloween spirit, and Amy falls into a particularly foul mood when she is forced to wear a fancy-dress costume during an undercover operation. Meanwhile, Jake bets Captain Holt that he can steal his Medal of Valour before midnight - a challenge that prompts him to don his own selection of disguises

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Jake makes an arrest without much proof, and so has to spend the next 48 hours collecting enough evidence to keep his suspect in custody. While his co-workers are forced to help him out over the weekend, Charles judges a pie contest between Rosa and Gina, and the Captain gives advice to Terry, who has a problem involving his brother-in-law. Comedy, starring Andy Samberg

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: In the last-ever episode of the US sitcom, there's an end and a beginning as the gang travel together into an uncharted future. Howard and Bernadette go away on a trip without their children for the first time, Leonard and Penny try to keep a secret, Sheldon and Amy stick together, and Raj makes a new friend

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Pilot episode of the comedy about scientists and their friendship with a down-to-earth neighbour. When aspiring actress Penny moves into Leonard's apartment block, he is immediately smitten, but Sheldon warns him that he runs the risk of a broken heart if he tries to woo her. Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco star

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny gets more than she bargained for when Leonard agrees to meet a psychiatrist on her behalf, while Sheldon and Raj collaborate on an astronomical discovery. Stuart moves out, but Howard and Bernadette's happiness is short-lived. Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco star

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: After being forced to deal with a sick Sheldon, the rest of the gang try to treat themselves to a Sheldon-free weekend. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Jay is troubled when best pal Shorty reveals that he and his wife are moving away. Phil and Claire take Haley out to discuss her future, while Mitchell and Cam take a break from all the wedding planning to enjoy a romantic meal - only to interrupt a couple's surprise engagement dinner. Chazz Palminteri and Jennifer Tilly guest star

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Claire thinks Luke is up to no good with his friends, so she persuades a reluctant Phil into helping her spy on their son. Gloria is suspicious of Jay when he starts moaning amorously in his sleep and Mitch struggles to keep a secret from Cam

programme.desc: Holt invites the entire squad to his house to celebrate his birthday, but Jeffords struggles to keep everyone in line, with Peralta and Santiago making a bad impression on their host's husband Kevin. programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets architect and shed fanatic Micah Jones, who plans to transform an old agricultural building in Co Down. Micah plans an upside-down, four-bedroom shed using new techniques and materials, but the £200,000 budget runs short and Micah is forced to take on some of the building work himself

programme.title: Falklands War: The Untold Story
programme.desc: Documentary examining the Falklands conflict 40 years on. The head of the SAS in the Falklands, Sir Michael Rose, speaks publicly for the first time about the war, and how the British task force came close to defeat. Plus, ground troops and senior commanders, many for the first time, reveal how an unexpected change in the plan for the land campaign nearly cost Britain the war, and led to unnecessary loss of life at the iconic Battle of Goose Green, and in the sinking of the Sir Galahad

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Cora, 62, arrives by air ambulance following a high-speed road accident, which left her trapped in the car for more than an hour. Her husband Rae, 65, who was driving, is brought in soon after, and staff are concerned he may have sustained serious head, neck and internal injuries. Scott, 23, has badly cut his knee after a night out, and while he's being treated, he reflects on his schizophrenia diagnosis as a teenager. Retired carpenter Richard, 68, has fallen and hit his head on the pavement, but medics also want to look into his unusually low blood pressure

programme.title: Billion Pound Cruise
programme.desc: Daily life on the mammoth cruise ship the Symphony of the Seas, revealing how some of the 6,680 guests occupy themselves on board this billion-pound vessel that's full of surprises

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jon Richardson takes on guest captain Johnny Vegas in another round of words-and-numbers chaos. Their team-mates are Alex Brooker and Sara Pascoe, while Claudia Winkleman and Rob Beckett stand in for Rachel Riley on letters-and-numbers duty, and Tom Allen is in Dictionary Corner with Susie Dent. Hosted by Jimmy Carr

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Kate Quilton visits the world's largest jelly bean producers to discover what they are made of instead of gelatine, and Matt Tebbutt finds out why maple syrup is so expensive

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: House hunter Zane wants to permanently relocate to Mijas in Spain to be closer to his son Dean, who has already moved there with his family. Danni Menzies shows the father and son five properties within the £110,000 budget, hoping at least one will prove perfect

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: The owners of a glampsite have transport trouble in Portugal. A former art teacher opens a gallery in Spain, while mother-and-daughter equestrians hope to ride out a rough patch

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien visit two sisters at their south Wales workshop, where their restorations and upcycles include a Gothic-style organ and a half-size snooker table

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole comes across a tractor and Simon O'Brien finds a small-wheeled design classic as the pair search for money-making items in Norfolk

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate detectives search for the relatives of a well-loved Leicestershire lady, and on another case they learn how the industrial revolution impacted Victorian bakeries

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Pencader, Carmarthenshire, at the School House B&B, owned by eco-friendly married couple Jayne and Ian Hall-Edwards, who hope that their environmental approach will impress their guests. At dinner, Ian reveals that his hosting skills might not be up to scratch and eyebrows are raised at straight-talking colleagues Jo and Neil. At breakfast, assumptions are made of businessman Raj

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Cathedral 73 in Cardiff, managed by Neil Chidzey. On arrival, guests are wowed by the glamorous rooms, but Raj is shocked to find breakfast is not included

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week takes place at Leafy Suburban B&B in Northwood, Hertfordshire, where the guests spend the afternoon taking a swing at some golfing

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit is to the Wellington Inn, Hertfordshire, where Felicity Rainbow takes a spiritual approach, cleansing the aura of the rooms and encouraging guests to feel the vibe

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they've been paid and to settle some scores. The School House B&B is first and host Jayne Hall-Edwards takes guests back to basics over her green policy. Next, Neil Chidzey and Jo Goodwin from Cathedral 73 challenge their guests over costings

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer search across two countries for two homes. Kirstie is with serial renters Mike and Poppy. Mike has lived in 18 homes, but Poppy wants to put down roots and they've chosen Cheshire as the right spot for their family. However, living in a high spec rental has given them great expectations for the home they'd love to own. Phil is in north Wales, helping nature-loving Pip, who's in search of a rural retreat, a chocolate-box character cottage with a garden big enough for chickens

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It: Brilliant Builds
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer look back to some of their favourite properties from the show and offers tips and tricks to help viewers make the best of their homes. As well as catching up with some of the families that previously featured, Kirstie and Phil focus on the layout issues and dilemmas that many of us now face in a very different world. In this episode, the duo tackle future-proofing, as two families at very different stages of their lives tackle tricky renovations in a last-ditch attempt to make their homes work for the long term

programme.title: Crufts 2023
programme.desc: Clare Balding and Sophie Morgan present coverage of the first stage of judging for the Gundog group. Dancing and discipline take centre stage in Heelwork to Music. Plus, a look at the Dandie Dinmont terrier as Frank Kane begins a series of features on British breeds

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Professional deep-sea diver Adrian Corrigall and his wife Megan plan to build their new family home in rural East Sussex almost entirely out of concrete, with construction involving cutting-edge technologies conceived in Switzerland and never used to build a house before. However, the perils of being a pioneer soon become evident, and with both schedule and budget under strain, Adrian is forced to resume work as a diver, taking him away from the project for a month at a time

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The A&E documentary series turns its attention to caring and kindness at St George's Hospital in south-west London, highlighting altruistic acts from staff, patients and visitors alike. A 13-year-old cyclist experiencing bouts of unconsciousness is sent for a CT scan, and 84-year-old Ursula, who was born in Germany, arrives in resus having lost a lot of blood during a series of severe nose-bleeds. Plus, 76-year-old Margaret is brought in to St George's after suffering a suspected stroke during a routine appointment at another hospital, and the doctors must quickly administer a clot-busting drug if they are to prevent further damage to her brain

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency?
programme.desc: Wiltshire is home to 15,000 military personnel, meaning its emergency services face a battle dealing with incidents related to the large military population. Fights between squaddies and civilians are common, but with an 80 per cent rise in mental health issues over the past eight years, increasingly the emergency services are dealing with problems caused to soldiers - as well as by them. In Swindon, a 24-year-old in basic training is arrested and brought into custody on suspicion of carrying out a totally unprovoked attack on a 76-year-old widower

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Junior doctor Simon is concerned 40-year-old doorman Alfred, who was stabbed multiple times outside the social club where he works, may have internal injuries. Eighteen-year-old student George is brought into resus with blood coming from his ear and behaving erratically, following a fight at a party, and is sent for an urgent scan when consultant Phil becomes worried he may have a life-threatening bleed on his brain

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics Jas Panesar and Amy Cullen rush to a woman who has had a severe allergic reaction at a restaurant. In Birmingham, paramedics Naomi Whatley and Mark McDonagh attend to a man who has fallen unconscious after a severe diabetic attac, while in Warwick, paramedics treat a man who has collapsed with a suspected heart attack

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jon Richardson and Sean Lock face off once again in another unpredictable battle of words and numbers, with help from Kevin Bridges and Rebecca Front. Rachel Riley is on maths-and-letters duty, and Joe Lycett is in Dictionary Corner with Susie Dent

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The A&E documentary series turns its attention to caring and kindness at St George's Hospital in south-west London, highlighting altruistic acts from staff, patients and visitors alike. A 13-year-old cyclist experiencing bouts of unconsciousness is sent for a CT scan, and 84-year-old Ursula, who was born in Germany, arrives in resus having lost a lot of blood during a series of severe nose-bleeds. Plus, 76-year-old Margaret is brought in to St George's after suffering a suspected stroke during a routine appointment at another hospital, and the doctors must quickly administer a clot-busting drug if they are to prevent further damage to her brain

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Mick and Dianne from Newcastle want to make a permanent move to the sun. Ben Hillman helps them find their perfect place around Gran Alacant on the Costa Blanca, showing them properties within their budget of £120,000

programme.title: Kirstie's Vintage Gems
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp introduces new crafts, skills and techniques for interior decoration. In this edition, she reveals how to create a personalised doormat and coasters, using spray paint, old tiles and serviettes

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Cornwall couple Marc and Matt fell in love with Majorca the moment they stepped onto the island six years ago and are now looking to buy their very own holiday retreat that they can escape to at a moments notice. Armed with a budget of £200,000, Ben Hillman tries to find them their dream pad in the perfect location

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: As the season draws to a close for the Brits abroad, the owners of a glampsite in Portugal get hands-on at a goat farm. In France, two Brits attempt to host a wine-tasting night. Meanwhile, at a riding centre, a mother and daughter have cause to celebrate

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien find unique items lost in people's homes to fix up for a profit. Henry is barn searching on his doorstep in Oxfordshire, while Simon makes the long journey down from Liverpool. It's a 'tank off!' as Simon hatches a wacky plan to turn some old tanks into a pizza oven, while Henry turns a redundant water tank into a mobile shelving unit

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien find unique items lost in people's homes to fix up for a profit. The boys head east to Suffolk to meet Margaret - an avid collector and former mayor - so need to be on their best behaviour

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: A new lead opens up on a case that has been unsolved for 24 years - but will it be the clue the heir hunters have been waiting for? Meanwhile, the search for heirs of a Romford woman reveals a link to the story that inspired the film Made in Dagenham. Plus, details of two unclaimed estates where heirs still need to be found.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts at the Ship Inn in Dymchurch, Kent, where James Tindall and Jessica Walton hope to impress their guests and be named best value for money

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Thompson Hall Retreat in Norfolk, boasting stylish shepherd huts, and run by mother and daughter duo Amanda Benton and Becci Howlett

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week takes place at The White House in Swansea, where guests James and Jessica have an unusual toilet encounter in their room

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Jacobs Plough in Bicester, Oxfordshire, run by manager Duncan Froomes and bar supervisor Ryan Hunt who like to mix banter with business

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final day of the competition sees the B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they've been paid and settle some scores. The Ship Inn is up first, with managers James Tindall and Jessica Walton wanting to let off steam about the surprise comments that made their visit a heated affair

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer go house-hunting to help one family and one pair of first-time buyers navigate the Bristol market. Kirstie's poker-loving couple, Liz and Ben, want to buy in their beloved Clifton where they have been renting. Meanwhile, Phil's searching for Greg and Joanna, who want to find a property in a family-friendly area within walking distance of daughter Oliwia's new school

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It: Brilliant Builds
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer look back on two period properties that desperately needed to be adapted for modern-day living. They meet the Sarah and Ian Renard in Brixworth, Northamptonshire. With one toddler and two dogs to house, this two-bed rural semi is bursting at the seams and Ian wants out. There's only one thing stopping him: Sarah, who is determined to stay and convinced that the house still has the potential to cater for a growing family. They also meet Graham and his partner Ryan who have been fighting over their 17th-century cottage in Cranleigh for years. Charming though it may be, it does not offer the space the two of them now need

programme.title: Crufts 2023
programme.desc: Further coverage from the NEC in Birmingham. Dogs in all shapes and sizes climb, weave and jump over obstacles at top speed on the Agility course in the main arena. Frank Kane continues his tour of British breeds with the much-loved Welsh corgi, while the latest candidate for the Kennel Club's 'Hero Dog' competition is revealed

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien are in the South Wales Valleys, where sisters Carly and Holly ask them to dig out some treasure from their father's unwanted collection of furniture

programme.title: The Great Pottery Throw Down
programme.desc: It's the semi-final and the potters are making pieces for the bathroom before taking on the iconic Moorcroft tube lining in the surprise second challenge. Judges Keith Brymer Jones and Rich Miller have a tough choice deciding who will go through to the following week's grand finale

programme.title: The Wall: Cover Your Tracks
programme.desc: A new disappearance worries the police so Celine sends out a search party. Meanwhile, the runaways are tracked and found, and a troubling confession follows. Mystery drama, starring Isabel Richer. In French

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The emergency room documentary continues, highlighting the stories of people facing adversity head-on. Erin, a 61-year-old former cancer patient with an ear infection, is rushed to St George's Hospital after she collapsed at home. Doctors fear the condition may have spread to her brain, and send her for a CT scan to find out more. Tony, a 70-year-old part-time DJ, arrives in A&E after being involved in a high-speed bicycle accident while training for a 100-mile charity bike ride, and Charlie, a 39-year-old cabin crew worker, turns up at the hospital complaining of unbearable pain after discharging himself during a previous visit, and removing the cast fitted to support his broken arm

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The documentary detailing the daily work of staff at St George's Hospital in south-west London continues, this time highlighting the stories of patients who received support from loved ones when life became tough. Gerald, a 66-year-old lifeguard and polo club official is rushed into A&E, having sustained a serious head wound after a 10-foot fall. The friends and family of 55-year-old Beverly gather at the hospital when she is admitted with a broken leg after being hit by a car near her home, and Paul, a 39-year-old father-of-three, arrives in resus with a nasty cut to his right arm. Paul complains that he is unable to move his fingers, leading staff to believe be may have significant tendon or nerve damage that could leave him permanently unable to use his hand

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics in Birmingham try to stop hypothermia from setting in when a woman collapses in the snow. At the same time, Mark and Adi attend to a woman whose waters may have broken at 27 weeks and could be hours away from giving birth. In Coventry, crewmates Neil and Laura treat an elderly man who has a life-threatening infection

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

The couple have their hearts set on a new build property and have asked Laura Hamilton to help find them the perfect one. Laura lines up various options for their maximum budget of £260,000, but will any impress them enough to make an offer?

programme.title: Survivor South Africa

programme.title: Rick Stein's India
programme.desc: The chef goes in search of the best chicken korma in Lucknow, learns the complexities of making rice dish pulao and joins thousands of partygoers at one of India's major Hindu festivals. Further north in Punjab, he observes the age-old process involved in the production of the unrefined sugar known as jaggery and is recruited as a guest judge to find the state's new 'Star Chef'. Rick also demonstrates how to make nimish, a dessert with hints of saffron, pistachios and cardamom, as well as vegetarian curry paneer jalfrezi

programme.title: The Force: Behind the Line
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary series. Officers in Australia investigate disturbing phone footage depicting animal cruelty and three men who are relaxing with illegal drugs after a workout.

programme.title: The Force: Behind the Line

programme.desc: Mick Sweetmore's team tries to fix a radio issue in a bid to keep the new pursuit cars on the tail of Merseyside's criminals. There's a surprise visit from the fleet's oldest member, and the bosses get dirty hands when things go wrong on the road

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Chris Harris and Freddie Flintoff check out a new hot hatch from Honda and an old hot hatch from Peugeot. Paddy McGuinness takes on his toughest challenge to date: getting a team of young amateur racers up to professional motorsport standard, in just two months

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The team carries out some consumer testing, taking a look at 50 family cars on the market and whittling them down to he best three. programme.desc: John and Alison Peart from Devon are at a crossroads. With Alison hoping to retire in the next year and John being made redundant, they're focusing all their attention on finding a new home. While Alison wants to split her time to spend half the year in Dorset, close to their family, and the other six months in Tenerife, her favourite place, John would happily relocate permanently to Tenerife. Laura Hamilton shows them three fantastic homes in Dorset for their maximum £400,000 UK budget while Jonnie Irwin tempts them with three amazing properties in Tenerife for up to £235,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Celebrity photographer John wants to celebrate his 60th birthday by relocating to the idyllic Greek Island of Skopelos. Having fallen in love with its beautiful scenery and relaxing way of life, all he needs is to find his dream property - so friend Helen is coming along for support. Ben Hillman selects five options to put in the frame for his £120,000 budget, hoping at least one will be John's idea of perfection

programme.title: The Great Pottery Throw Down
programme.desc: It's the semi-final and the potters are making pieces for the bathroom before taking on the iconic Moorcroft tube lining in the surprise second challenge

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics are back to tuck into their takeaways while watching the best of the week's TV and streaming output, sharing their thoughts for the rest of the viewing public to see

programme.title: George Michael: Outed
programme.desc: Part one of two. How the singer's outing was a landmark moment in gay politics, with a potential career-ending scandal being averted by seizing control of the media narrative. The first episode looks back at the singer's early career, and unearths the reasons he felt compelled to remain in the closet in the first place. Featuring contributions from former manager Simon Napier-Bell and Rev Richard Coles, who recalls his own experiences of being a gay man and a pop star in the 1980s

programme.title: George Michael: Outed
programme.desc: Part two of two. How George Michael announced his sexuality to the world in 1998 and the events that led to it including losing his partner to an Aids-related illness, being arrested for committing a lewd act in a public toilet and threats from the News of the World to publish pictures of him cruising in a park. Will Young shares how the events gave hope to young gay men at the time

programme.title: The Piano
programme.desc: The final stop on the search for Britain's best amateur pianists is Birmingham New Street Station. Featuring a toe-tapping Jerry Lee Lewis hit and a unique Harry Styles cover. There is not a dry eye in the station when a Welsh retiree goes on a trip down memory lane. As per usual, the unsuspecting performers are being watched by Lang Lang and Mika who are looking for a pianist to play at the Royal Festival Hall

programme.title: Kathy Burke: Growing Up
programme.desc: Kathy Burke contemplates if she should fight or accept old age and asks if it's easier or harder to be young in today's world by speaking to some ordinary people with extraordinary lives. In the first of this two-part special, Kathy examines getting older and how she feels about what is to come in later life, she learns from 85 year-old model Bridget and a 70 year-old dominatrix that raging against the realities that come with old age might be the secret to aging disgracefully and with dignity. Featuring contributions from Bill Bailey and Jennifer Saunders

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on Bad Sisters, Nadiya's Everyday Baking, The Kardashians, Super/Natural, Emma Willis: Delivering Babies, and A Trip to Infinity, as well as BBC News reports on the energy cap and a U-turn by Kwasi Kwarteng. First broadcast in October 2022

programme.title: Jamie's £1 Wonders
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver presents recipes that keep costs under control in the kitchen. In the first episode, he shares a roast chicken recipe that saves both time and money by filling chicken thighs with a super-simple stuffing to make the meat stretch further. Plus, a pancake batter-based dish with layers of spinach, ham and cheese and a pizza that doesn't even need you to turn on the oven

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Mark and Caroline want a bolthole on Spain's stunning Orihuela Costa that works for all the family and is close to the golf courses. Scarlette Douglas shows them what their £100,000 budget can secure

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Customer relations associate and part-time drag queen Adam plans a theatrical night of flamboyance as the culinary competition continues in the Derby and Nottingham area. Can he get his guests begging for an encore, will Alastair and Lesley ever kiss and make up and what will Adam's guests think of his secret hobby as a ufologist?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The final soiree in the Nottingham and Derby area sees 57-year-old Lesley counting on a night of glamour and glitz - plus some good home-cooked food - to secure the £1,000 prize. However, before any food is even dished up, the guests make a surprising discovery about the host

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman heads to the Charente region of France to help a couple find a holiday home to enjoy with their children and grandchildren. For their budget of £250,000, Sarah and Greg would like a traditional French cottage or converted barn with four bedrooms in a rural location

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Grandparents Alan and Elisa Bowers have lived in Plymouth for all of their lives and are itching for a new start, but are torn between moving to the beautiful Cornwall coast to stay close to family, or relocating to Lanzarote, their dream location. programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer search Bristol with Josh and Anna, who are buying their first home together, and Sue and Samira, who are moving from London to a city they barely know for a change of pace in their life. However, one couple have a budget that falls short of their requirements, while the other pair appear to lack confidence when it comes to making a decision

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It: Brilliant Builds
programme.desc: Kirstie and Phil look back on two very different downstairs dilemmas, with one family surrendering their space to pets and another struggling to entertain the community they serve. Newly-weds Matt and Lucia struggled to fit their family into their living space as most of it had been given to their rescued pets, while Baptist minister Chris and Caroline had a severe lack of space in an already-extended property as they regularly host upwards of 14 people in their four-bed home

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets master carpenter Olaf, who is facing the biggest challenge of his career - creating an oasis for himself and partner Fritha on a small slice of land in West Sussex, which happens to be surrounded by a mainline railway and a busy A-road. Not only that, but half of the plot can't even be built on due an underground mains sewer. All they're left with is a very small triangle on which to build their future life together. With £190,000 in the bank, Olaf and Fritha must use all the ingenuity they can muster to make their triangular three-bedroom house come to life

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A doctor shares his story of leaving his family and newborn child during lockdown to keep them safe. An 11-year-old hit by a car shows signs of possible internal bleeding, and a 60-year-old woman is injured after tripping over her cat. A footballer being treated for injuries to his achilles tendon describes how the sport has been an escape for him during his childhood in south London

programme.title: Katie Price's Mucky Mansion
programme.desc: Katie creates her own makeup room and brings new life to the shabby stables. After spotting a paparazzi photographer, she takes a moment to reflect on how these moments impact her mental health

programme.title: Kathy Burke: Growing Up
programme.desc: The actress contemplates getting older and explores the lives and experiences of the old and the young, wondering whether people should fight or accept old age. In the second of two programmes, Kathy examines being young and looks back on her much-loved youth when she was carefree and confident. Contributors include her showbiz pals Jennifer Saunders, Bill Bailey, Charlotte Church and TikTok sensation Francis Bourgeois

programme.title: Kathy Burke: Growing Up
programme.desc: Kathy Burke contemplates if she should fight or accept old age and asks if it's easier or harder to be young in today's world by speaking to some ordinary people with extraordinary lives. In the first of this two-part special, Kathy examines getting older and how she feels about what is to come in later life, she learns from 85 year-old model Bridget and a 70 year-old dominatrix that raging against the realities that come with old age might be the secret to aging disgracefully and with dignity. Featuring contributions from Bill Bailey and Jennifer Saunders

programme.title: George Clarke's Remarkable Renovations
programme.desc: Across Britain, more than 600,000 buildings lie unused and unloved, and nearly a third of them are commercial. Architect George Clarke follows people as they attempt to breathe new life into these properties. First up are Cornwall couple Richard and Sarah, who bought their former local high street bank for £50,000 and now face the challenge of converting the Victorian grade II-listed building into a unique family home

programme.title: The Piano
programme.desc: The final stop on the search for Britain's best amateur pianists is Birmingham New Street Station. Featuring a toe-tapping Jerry Lee Lewis hit and a unique Harry Styles cover. There is not a dry eye in the station when a Welsh retiree goes on a trip down memory lane. As per usual, the unsuspecting performers are being watched by Lang Lang and Mika who are looking for a pianist to play at the Royal Festival Hall

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps Sheffield couple Rob and Lisa find a three-bedroom holiday home with a swimming pool in the Lanzarote resort of Playa Blanca on a budget of £280,000

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Clairvoyant Yvette Tamara hosts the first dinner party in north Kent, and the night gets off to a spooky start when data analyst John Tower and working mother Yemi Christopher-Soares discover a ghost-busting machine. Meanwhile, jeweller Lisa Townend is so impressed with Yvette's abilities that she wants to return for a psychic reading

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Data analyst John Tower hosts the second dinner party in north Kent, and lets his passion for military re-enactment show when he barks orders at the table. However, not all the guests enjoy his fatty pork stew and psychedelic dessert, and two argue over dating etiquette

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Project manager Yemi Christopher-Soares hosts the third dinner party in north Kent, where she hopes the guests will enjoy her Nigerian-inspired menu and appreciate her love of all things spicy

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Jono Simm hosts the penultimate dinner party in north Kent and is convinced his wholesome and hearty menu is the way to win. However, two of his guests are less than impressed by his cooking

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Party-loving Lisa Townend hosts the final dinner party in north Kent, and hopes that a menu full of French fancies and innovative entertainment in the form of human roulette, will be enough to impress her guests and see her crowned winner of the £1,000 cash prize

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Childhood sweethearts Debbie and Tony Parkes have been married for 40 years, and are ready for a new chapter in their lives. With retirement around the corner, they've set their hearts on a holiday home in Albufeira on Portugal's Algarve with a budget of £80,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman heads to the Charente region of France to help a couple find a holiday home to enjoy with their children and grandchildren. For their budget of £250,000, Sarah and Greg would like a traditional French cottage or converted barn with four bedrooms in a rural location

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: In Italy, glamping site owner Kerry takes her business in a new direction, while in France Paul and Caroline find a creative solution to keep their garden craft courses running. A family from Hull are on the move again, but it remains to be seen whether Jacqui and Steve's new French property will be their 'forever home'

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: This competition takes place in and around Liverpool, where the first to host is 41-year-old taxi business owner Rob, who plans a Scouse themed evening. The guests he is hoping to impress are 23-year-old fitness fanatic Toria, 44-year-old property developer Christine, 40-year-old South African business woman Sam, and 20-year-old student Inzy

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is night two in Liverpool, and the turn of businesswoman Sam to try and impress with her South-African-themed evening, though her food is a bit hit and miss

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Gym worker Toria hosts the third party in Liverpool, and hopes a kissing game around the dinner table, along with her flaky flapjacks, will be enough to secure the £1,000 prize

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Undergraduate Inzy is the fourth host in Liverpool, and he is on a mission to prove students really can cook. The flirting between him and Toria continues, but will he allow love to stand in way of the competition?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Liverpool, property developer Christine plans to wow her guests with a Spanish holiday-themed dinner party. However, the mood is rather more feisty than fiesta as on-going tensions finally come to a head and it's not long before the honesty - and the sparks - begin to fly

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: With their children flying the nest, Andy and Alida have decided now is the time to fulfil their dream of buying a chalet in the French Alps. They are downsizing their house in Wokingham, Surrey, and splitting the funds between the UK and France, so Laura Hamilton and Jonnie Irwin have been sent on a joint mission. With a total of £650,000 to spend, and three shots each to find the perfect property - Laura in Berkshire and Jonnie in the ski-resort of Morzine - the pressure is really on for both of them to deliver

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps Linda and Alan Keir, who want to buy a holiday home in the Costa del Sol to escape the climate of the Scottish Highlands. They look at five properties on their budget of £150,000

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: The architect explores an arts and crafts-inspired house in Surrey. Built in the 1920s, it has tall chimneys, leaded windows, gabled ends and a steeply pitched roof. Sadly, it has Artex everywhere and incorporates some dubious design alterations. He sets out to help its owners turn it back into an elegant home for themselves and their three children. George also tackles a suburban home that has so many layers of wallpaper that peeling them back is like going back through a time warp

programme.desc: PC Tom Strachan gives pursuit when a car is spotted by police cameras being driven with no insurance, but when records flag up the suspect has a history of violence, an armed response team is called in too.
